items.content:
.Net Developer [REMOTE]

About this job

Job type: Full-time
Experience level: Mid-Level, Senior
Role: Backend Developer
Industry: Software Development
Company size: 51–200 people
Company type: Private
Company: Clevertech | No office location

Technologies

nosql
c#
.net
sql
asp.net

Job description

As a Senior Back End Data Engineer at Clevertech, you’ll be part of a global team striving to provide world-class, bespoke software solutions. We look to employ craftsmen developers who take pride and ownership of their code!

You can deliver quickly while being clever to avoid missteps. You have an effective positive attitude that shines through in your communication and care for client and colleague concerns. You are always learning and are a transparent communicator even when it is challenging. You thrive on challenging yourself daily and seek to surround yourself with like-minded individuals.

This role involves database design and implementation responsibilities including alternative data structures such as nosql, redis, elasticsearch and more.

REQUIREMENTS

  • 5+ years experience with complex data structures.
  • 5+ years experience developing in .Net
  • You have deep experience in the latest libraries and programming techniques.
  • You have accomplishments that showcase your capabilities by their success and technical depth.
  • You own new features from idea to completion.
  • Work well with a core team to design and execute major new features.
  • Familiar with SQL/NoSQL databases like MongoDB and their declarative query languages is a plus
  • Enjoy contributing to a fast-moving exciting project
  • Strong experience using GitHub in a professional environment
  • Strong communicator and fluent in English with excellent written and verbal communication skills.
  • Thrive and excel in our diverse, distributed and agile team environment
Apply now

About Clevertech

Clevertech is a leading consultancy that is on a mission to build transformational digital solutions for the world’s most innovative organizations. Enterprise companies turn to Clevertech to help them launch innovative digital products that interact with hundreds of millions of customers, transactions and data points. By partnering with Clevertech these companies are propelling forward and changing their industries, business models and more.

Based in New York City with fully remote development teams, Clevertech has built core product offerings for clients whose value was revealed in transactions valued in excess of $100 million.  

The problems we solve everyday are real and require creativity, grit and determination. We are building a culture that challenges norms while fostering experimentation and personal growth. We are hiring team members who are passionate and energized by the vision of empowering our customers in a complex industry through technology, data and a deep understanding of client concerns. In order to grasp the scale of problems we face, ideally you have some exposure to Logistics, FinTech, Transportation, Insurance, Media or other complex multifactor industries.

Our Benefits

We know that people do their best work when they’re taken care of. So we make sure to offer great benefits.

  • Competitive Vacation Package
  • Annual Financial Allowance for YOUR development
  • Flexible Family Leave
  • Clevertech Gives Back Program
  • Clevertech U (Leadership Program, Habit Building, New Skills Training)
  • Clevertech Swag
  • Strong Clevertech Community

How We Work

Why do people join Clevertech? To make an impact. To grow themselves. To be surrounded by developers who they can learn from. We are truly excited to be creating waves in an industry under transformation.

True innovation comes from an exchange of knowledge across all of our teams. To put people on the path for success, we nurture a culture built on trust, collaboration, and personal growth. You will work in small feature-based cross-functional teams and be empowered to take ownership.

We make a point of constantly evolving our experience and skills. We value diverse perspectives and fostering personal growth by challenging everyone to push beyond our comfort level and try something new.

The result? We produce meaningful work

Getting Hired

We hire people from a variety of backgrounds who are respectful, collaborative, and introspective. Members of the tech team, for example, come from diverse backgrounds having worked as copy editors, graphic designers, and photographers prior to joining Clevertech.

Our hiring process focuses not only on your skills but also on your professional and personal ambitions. We want to get to know you. We put a lot of thought into the interview process in order to get a holistic understanding of you while being mindful of your time. You will solve problems derived from the work we do on a daily basis followed by thoughtful discussions around potential fit. Whatever the outcome, we want you to have a great candidate experience.

Want to learn more about Clevertech and the team? Check out clevertech.careers and our video highlighting Clevertech's Culture

Benefits

  • Full-Time Telecommuting
  • Flexible Schedules
  • Paid Time Off
  • Ability to Work with Cutting-Edge Technology
  • Opportunity to Work with and Learn from Top Developers
  • Contribute to Open Source
  • Flexible Family Leave
  • E-Reader for Trainings, Book Club, & Book Recommendations
  • Annual Personal Development Stipend

items.content:
Mid-Level to Senior .Net Full-Stack Developer ? DHS USCIS

Washington, DC - Work can be done remotely

Salary: $92,000 with full benefits

Position Description:

Responsible for participating in all phases of the development and maintenance life cycle, we are seeking a highly skilled developer who is comfortable with both front and back end programming ? and the infrastructure/servers that enable these technologies. A positive get-it-done attitude and excellent communication skills are a must. You should be a team player, have an Agile mindset and thrive in collaborative environment. Primary duties include, but are not limited to:
  • Maintain an active relationship working alongside clients to identify current and future business needs.
  • Analyze, comprehend and convert unfamiliar client business concepts into functional and/or technical requirements, and user stories.
  • Identity and apply appropriate software stack technologies to implement system functionality from user stories. Existing technology stack work primarily includes:
    • SQL Server 2014 database design / development
    • Entity Framework 6+ / ADO data repository development
    • RESTful WebApi (w/ OData 6+) services design / development
    • Asp.Net MVC (5+), jQuery, jTable, Bootstrap design / development
  • Stay abreast of developments in web application and programming language frameworks in order to propose/implement improvements and extensions to current technology stack as necessitated by the overall architecture and evolution of the system.
  • Integrate Unit and Component testing into system libraries. Troubleshoot and remedy defects identified during testing and re-execute tests to validate results.
Preferred Skills and Technologies:

Be a driving force for architectural vision and change, focusing on the introduction of useful design patterns and new technologies. If you are excited about driving forward development success, best practices, and being at the forefront of architecture research, this is a great position for you. Having a developer's mindset and a willingness to learn about the variety of technologies involved as an organization modernizes will serve well in this position.

Skill Summary: C#, .NET Framework, SQL, JavaScript, CSS, HTML, Visual Studio, WCF (SOAP), WebApi (OData) RESTful Services (JSON/XML), Entity Framework, ADO, IIS, SQL Server, AWS, Unit Testing, Component Testing, Functional Testing

Experience (1 - 2yrs exp or as otherwise noted) with most of the following concepts and associated software:
  • Advanced to expert (4+ years) C# knowledge and proficiency with .NET Framework 4.5+ or .NET Core 2.0+ Required
  • Advanced to expert (4+ years) ability to convert user stories into database schema design (tables, views, functions, stored procedures).
  • Advanced to expert (4+ years) SQL development using SQL / T-SQL (CTEs, Pivot/Unpivot, HAVING, GROUP BY, ROLLUP, etc.), and identifying and fine-tuning SQL queries.
  • Experience (3+ years) with data frameworks such as Entity Framework (6+), nHibernate, LINQ to DB, or ADO
  • Experience (3+ years) Implementing web services (WebApi, SOA, WCF) - RESTful OData experience preferred
  • Client-side browser development using Ajax, jQuery, React, or AngularJS, CSS, and HTML
  • Designing user interactions on web pages.
  • Agile methodologies such as Scrum
  • ASP.NET
  • Source control tools (GitHub, TFS, Rational)
Experience with the following would be a bonus:
  • Containerization (Docker, Kubernetes, OpenShift)
  • Building Continuous Integration / Continuous Delivery (CI/CD) Pipelines, Pipelines-as-code (GitHub, Jenkins)
  • AWS Cloud (EC2, S3, IAM, etc.)
  • Responsive Design
  • IoC/DI (Unity/Simple Injector)
  • Test Driven Development (TDD) using NUnit, Selenium, or comparable (JUnit, MSTest)
  • Media Type Formatters
  • Secure coding practices (SAML2, WS-FED, RBAC, ABAC, SSL, Encryption)
  • Web Server / Web Farm environment configuration and management (IIS Web Farms)
  • Database Server / Database Cluster (prefer SQL 2K12 or higher) configuration and management
Education and Qualifications:
  • Associate?s degree or higher in Computer Science or related fields; 5+ years experience on one platform, multi-database, multi-language or multi-business application, or any combination of education and experience which would provide an equivalent background. Candidate should also have the ability to mentor others, lead small projects and provide troubleshooting support.
  • U.S. Citizenship required in order to comply with law, regulation, executive order, or government contract.

items.title: Remote Malware Reverse Engineer
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=2, other=1, dotnet=43, c=24, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=8, frontend=0}
items.content:
Location: Charlotte, NC
Description:

Note: Potentially remote for candidates that possess all of the required skills


We are seeking an experienced Malware Analyst/Reverse Engineer to perform malware analysis and reverse engineering in support of incident response, investigative analysis, threat hunting, and research on existing and emerging cyber threats. The role will involve in-depth analysis of static and behavioral analysis of complex malicious code utilizing various tools, including disassemblers, debuggers, hex editors, un-packers, virtual machines, and network sniffers. The candidate will perform the functions of malware analyst/reverse engineer and serve as a liaison for Threat Services for the Global Fusion Center, and mentor and collaborate with the threat hunting, incident handling/response, and forensics teams.


Key Responsibilities

  • Use expertise in malware analysis/reverse engineering to evaluate and analyze complex malicious code.
  • Perform reverse-engineering for suspected or known malware files, determining the TTPs associated with the code.
  • Develop custom tools designed to automate analysis.
  • Perform research around malicious software, vulnerabilities, and exploitation tactics, and recommend preventative or defensive actions.
  • Produce detailed reports identifying attributes and functionality of malware, and IOCs that can be used for malware identification/detection, to include behavior, identified infrastructure used for command and control, and mitigation techniques.
  • Assist in identifying (hunting) and profiling threat actors and TTPs.
  • Develop host and network based signatures to identify specific malware via heuristic and/or anomaly based detection methods.
  • Participate in formal technical briefing and proposals.
  • Perform as an Information Security SME in the several of the following areas:
  • Malicius code behavior
  • Threat Intelligence
  • Incident Respnse
  • Web Applicatin
  • Lg analysis (statistical modeling, correlation, pattern recognition, etc.Microsoft platform (Server, workstation, applications)
  • Key Responsibilities (Cont'd)
  • Open Systems platfrms (Linux, UNIX, VM Ware ESX)
  • Netwrking (firewalls, IDS/IPS, packet capture)
  • Databases (Oracle, SQL Server, DB2, IMS)


  • Providing mentorship and support to teammates regarding malicious file analysis/behavior, communication/rapport with other divisions and various levels of leadership, technical expertise, and career development.
  • Capable of identifying need & driving solutions, and providing guidance, in an autonomous manner.


Job Qualifications

  • Bachelors and/or Masters Degree in Engineering, Computers Science, or related field
  • 5+ years overall technical experience in either reverse engineering/malware analysis, threat intelligence, incident response, security operations, or related information security field.
  • 5+ years experience in application design/engineering, including but not limited to programming/scripting, Windows/Linux system administration, RDBMS/NoSQL database administration, etc.
  • 2+ years experience in penetration testing or ethical hacking
  • 2+ years experience with reverse engineering tools like IDA Pro, Ghidra, OllyDbg, Windbg, and Wireshark.
  • 2+ years experience of Python scripting to automate analysis and reverse engineering tasks (and Bash or Powershell or PerlC/C++).
  • 2+ years experience of x86, ARM, and x64 architectures.
  • Ability to reverse engineer binaries of various types including: x86, x64, C, C++, and .NET.
  • Strong understanding of Windows Operating System Internals, Windows APIs, and writing and analyzing DLLs.
  • Recent experience developing custom software and hardware tools to assist in performing reverse engineering and vulnerability analysis.
  • Strong understanding of common network and application stack protocols, including but not limited to TCP/IP, SMTP, DNS, TLS, XML, HTTP, etc.


Experience with security operations tools, including but not limited to:

  • SIEM (e.g. Splunk, ArcSight)
  • Indicatr management (e.g. ThreatConnect)
  • Link/relatinship analysis (e.g. Maltego, IBM i2 Analyst Notebook)
  • Signature develpment/management (e.g. Snort rules, Yara rules)


Contact:

This job and many more are available through The Judge Group. Find us on the web at
- provided by Dice

items.title: Full-stack .NET and HTML+CSS+JS Developer (Junior to Early Career)
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=96, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=1, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=28}
items.content:
Likvido.com

 

Full-stack .NET and Html+css+js Developer (junior to Early Career)


Worldwide
Hi future Likvido-developer! We're looking for a full-stack developer to join our awesome, fully-remote, development team. Tasks will involve everything from implementing pages in ASP.NET MVC Razor (HTML+CS+JS) to making backend services. This is a "junior" to "early-career" position. Expect bit variety in tasks, and you can learn a lot! Since we launched Likvido in April 2018, we’ve absolutely nailed it. Not only do we now have 1.000+ customers - among many of the hottest startups and scaleups in Denmark - we also managed to get very serious funding, have very good unit economics and built a really cool technical platform. However, we’re just getting started. So what are we doing? We are solving the biggest reason for companies going bankrupt in Europe. You see, 19 % of all invoices are paid late, and roughly half of all bankruptcies are caused by lack of cash. Likvido is defining a new category we’re calling a “customer payment system”. Today you integrate Likvido with your accounting system, and then we automate sending out invoices, send our reminders, start debt collection and post back to the accounting system. Looking ahead, we will add financial products, give the whole organization access to our system and much more. In brief, we help companies get paid - on time - and forecast their cash flow. # Responsibilities The platform is ~18 months old. We have a big monolith ASP.NET MVC application, combined with 3 solid ASP.NET Core microservices. Everything is hosted in Azure and Github, and we use many of the Azure products, including Azure DevOps. The frontend is based on the "Porto Admin Theme" (typical Bootstrap admin theme), and we use a mix of Vue.js (complex pages) and jQuery (on simple pages). The job: You will be tasked to implement MANY different things. Examples: - Implement design files in HTML+CSS+JS (in ASP.NET MVC Razor) - Make (simple) backend services that store data - Fix bugs in solution - Make web-jobs - Improve the user experience - Write unit tests Basically, you will receive a large variety of whatever tasks on the platform. The plan is you will be the most junior on the team, and you will get many of the "simplest tasks" in many different categories # Requirements This is a "junior" to "early-career" position. So the most important things for us: - You're smart & ambitious - You have some kind of educational background (preferably University) in relation to software development - You will need to have at least a few years of experience in .NET technologies and ASP.NET MVC (full-time experience not required). - You will need to have at least a few years of experience in building JavaScript + HTML + CSS solutions (full-time experience not required) You're of course welcome to apply if you have more experience. However, expect the salary to reflect the expected role, not your experience. #Location - Worldwide

items.title: Configuration Engineer // Zattoo
tags: DBG:surround``3N( OR(feasibl,OR(consid,consider),option,occas,opportun,possibl,abil), OR(3N(remot, work),telecommut,2N(work,home)) ) NOT OR(regularli, abracadabra)

items.content:
Configuration Engineer // Zattoo

Company: Zattoo

Tags:

The Role

Next to Zattoo’s B2C efforts, B2B plays an increasingly important role. Our proven approach is to bring the same top notch technology, world class user experience and unprecedented know how in content to our business customers. In most cases those are Network Operators or Telcos, who want to provide their customers competitive TV services without the need to take care of the growing complexity of multi-screen TV requirements.

We are looking for a Configuration Engineer (f/m/x) that is willing and capable to understand our technology stack and business logic and is able to communicate it well to internal stakeholders and existing and potential future customers. In turn the person should learn and understand the needs of the customers to help make the joint TV product successful. You should have the ability to easily learn everything possible about Zattoo’s service and platform and dive deep into the configurability of our fully hosted and managed whitelabel product.

You will find Zattoo to be a comfortable place to work at with our flat hierarchies, pragmatic decision making, fast approval paths and willingness to take risks. Most importantly, you’ll be surrounded by colleagues who’ll share your commitment to developing and selling world class products.

What you’ll do

  • Become an expert in our middleware and business logic, use this expertise to design and plan meaningful configuration matrix for B2B partnerships
  • Build and compose applications on all supported native and web-based platforms such as iOS/tvOS, android: mobile, TV, fireTV, STB, web-app/web-based STB/chromeCast & windows Universal app
  • Implement configurations and permissions into our middleware services
  • Design permission rules and packages and arrange lineups, channels and qualities to reflect and adapt our partners product logic
  • Understand B2B project needs and maturity and provide technical guidance for stakeholders and integration partners
  • Setup and configure internal and external distribution services such as build servers or app stores for release preparation
  • Work in an agile team and closely together with QA, Client Success Management and Project Management to ensure and constantly improve our customers products

What you’ll bring

  • Experience using formatting languages such as JSON or YAML
  • Knowledge and experience with CI services and build systems (Jenkins/Travis)
  • Skilful in writing helper tools in Python or comparable programming languages to simplify daily work and automate recurring tasks
  • Independent, structured, thorough and well organized working style with the ability to handle multiple tasks with various priorities
  • Intelligence to connect business requirements and technical feasibility
  • Excellent verbal and written English skills with the ability to work across all levels and functions
  • Open minded, outgoing personality with the ability to develop strong relationships with different internal Zattoo teams
  • Bachelor’s degree in a relevant field such as Computer Science/IT or similar experience
  • Bonus: Engineering experience in an internet company or Cable Operator/Telco
  • Bonus: Experience with agile development methodologies and remote teams
  • Bonus: Deep understanding of OTT TV market (VoD, live streaming, netPVR)

Here’s what we offer you

  • Highly motivated, growing, diverse team made up of 33 different nationalities
  • Flexible work schedules and options to work from home
  • Flat hierarchies and open door policy
  • Competitive compensation and vacation entitlement
  • Social events ranging from company lunches and after work drinks to annual off site company events
  • Free yoga classes, German language classes and health checks
  • ☕⚽️

The B2B Team

As of today, Zattoo’s B2B unit counts more than 25 customers including 1&1 Telekom in Germany and Salt in Switzerland for whom Zattoo offers fully hosted and managed IPTV & OTT Services. What started as a small team and a limited number of customers has established itself an additional, successful business division alongside the company’s B2C-Business.

The Zattoo B2B Team is a diverse mix of experts, everything from sales, marketing, product, portfolio management to project, engineering and client success management. We combine years of experience along with a high degree of responsibility and professionalism. We emphasize team-spirit and encourage a hands-on mentality as much as a strong and market-oriented work ethic and believe that successful customer acquisition and project implementations, as well as a fast growing number of happy customers, can only be achieved through a motivated and empowered team.

We are Zattoo

Zattoo enables our users to view indiscriminately and we reflect that in our team too. Regardless of race, gender, sexual orientation, religion, national origin, age, disability or any other characteristic protected by law we encourage everyone to apply and will give everyone equal consideration. We are an equal opportunities employer, join us and help build a diverse team dedicated to revolutionising the way you watch TV.

You can learn more about us at: https://zattoo.com

Apply for this position

items.content:
Avanti Recruitment is working with a Digital Media company based in central London who are on the market for a remote-working Full-stack .NET Developer. They have a custom-built platform which has really progressed their global success in the last few years, you will play a key part in the ongoing developments for this platform, they are highly data-driven so building and improving their back-end system is vital to the plans for next year.

They are looking for Developers who take pride in their work and are looking to make an impact in a market-leading product, you will be working in a close-knit team of high-quality developers where you will have the freedom to use front-end frameworks of your choice. They are looking for solid all-rounders, so strong experience in C#, MVC and Javascript is essential. They are currently re-writing their front-end in Vue.js, exposure to this isn't a must-have as training will be provided based on your knowledge and experience.

They look for individuals who doesn't think of coding as a job but as a passion, you will play a key part working with experienced all-round developers reporting into the Product Manager. To ensure everything is on course they conduct morning stand-ups and code reviews are conducted on a regular basis.

Full Tech Stack:

C# MVC
WebAPI
Javascript - HTML / CSS
Azure
Vuejs
Knockoutjs
SQL Server
Personal portfolio - GitHub / Stack overflow
Computer Science degree

This is an excellent opportunity to work with a market-leading product which has taken the industry by storm with great career prospects. The company are based in central London and can offer up to £75k with Share options, 3% matched pension, 24 days holiday, plus 4-5 days off during Christmas and regular social events including nights out.

For more information on this exciting opportunity please apply online now! Feel free to contact Luke Johnson at Avanti Recruitment to discuss the role

items.content:
Minimum Required Skills:
C#, Python, Java, Mendix, SQL Server, MySQL

If you are a Senior Software Developer with experience, please read on!

This is a 100% remote position that requires experience with Mendix.

Top Reasons to Work with Us

As a Senior Software Engineer you will be an integral part of our engineering team, serving as a key contributor to solution design, development and release. You will be working with key stakeholders from the product and business teams as well as other software developers to ensure proper delivery. The software engineer contributes to system design, database design, and feature execution while adhering to coding standards and participating in code reviews.

You understand software design, standard coding principles, database operations and code optimization. In addition, you understand the Mendix platform; specifically how to apply domain models, UI models and microflows to deliver scalable solutions.

In this role you will focus on delivering products and solutions that directly impact internal and external user?s day-to-day productivity. You must be able to balance the desire system elegance against the new for rapid delivery.

What You Will Be Doing

Your focus will be:
Software design, prototyping and development
Following standard coding practices
Work on assignments as directed
Coordinate works across the team

Major responsibilities of this role include:
Establish and maintain coding standard and practices
Participate in software design decisions
Coordinate work on individual sprints
Work with the development team, scrum master and product owners
Collaborate with team members on coding decisions

What You Need for this Position

Education:
A Bachelor of Science in computer science is highly desired for this role or highly demonstrable experience in performing software development, and design work

Experience:
3+ years in a software development role as an individual contributor
1+ years working with Mendix on major business systems
Experience with web applications and mobile applications

Skills & Abilities:
Strong interpersonal skills working with business and technical teams
Strong organizational and process management skills
High degree of creativity and problem-solving ability
Able to set and manage priorities
Strong writing abilities with user requirements, use cases and user stories

What's In It for You

- Vacation/PTO
- Medical
- Dental
- Vision
- Relocation
- Bonus
- 401kSo, if you are a Senior Software Developer with experience, please apply today!

Applicants must be authorized to work in the U.S.Please apply directly to by clicking 'Click Here to Apply' with your Word resume!

Looking forward to receiving your resume and going over the position in more detail with you.

- Not a fit for this position? Click the link at the bottom of this email to search all of our open positions.

Looking forward to receiving your resume!

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

  • Demonstrated strong analytical and problem-solving skills
  • Experience with systems integration preferred
  • Development within Dynamics CRM platform
  • Experienced with customization and configuration
  • C# and .NET development
  • Demonstrated excellent judgment with the ability to independently solve problems and make decisions with little or no need for direct supervision
  • Demonstrated strong attention to detail
  • Demonstrated strong time management and organizational skills

  • Experience integrating Dynamics CRM with other UI & middle tier technologies
  • Must have hands on experience using the following:
    • C#, ASP.Net
    • JavaScript
    • XRM Page Model
    • JQuery
    • AJAX
    • Developers Toolkit
    • Custom Web Services
Benefits:
  • Base salary of up to 110K with bonus
  • Benefits include 100% paid health, dental, vision
  • 401(k) retirement savings program that matches your contribution (up to 7% of salary)
  • 20 days off from year to start (plus 10 paid holidays)
If you are willing to make an impact from day one and be part of a culture you are proud of apply as soon as possible!
The client is actively interviewing! If this is a role you would like to explore further, please send your resume to Amreen Qaiyum at [Click Here to Email Your Resum?] or feel free to call (ext 7583) TODAY!

By specializing solely in placing candidates in the Microsoft Dynamics market I have built relationships with most of the key employers in North America and have an unrivalled understanding of where the best opportunities and Dynamics CRM jobs are.
I understand the need for discretion and would welcome the opportunity to speak to any Microsoft Dynamics CRM candidates that are considering a new career or job either now or in the future. items.title: 100% Remote Sitecore Developer
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=74, c=4, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=1, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=65}
items.content:
Top Three Skills:1. Experience customizing Sitecore or another major .NET web based CMS such as EPiServer, Ektron, Sitefinity, or SDL.
2. Experience developing enterprise web applications on cloud VM's (IaaS) using continuous delivery or continuous integration.
3. Full stack .NET development experience (C#, ASP.NET MVC, WebAPI, MVC). Angular strongly preferred but other JavaScript libraries such as Knockout, React, or Ember is ok.

Plus: Marketing automation experience of any kind; Hubspot, Marketo, etc.

DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES

* Design software from user stories, business, functional & non-functional requirements in conjunction with business and technical staff
* Produce class diagrams, component diagrams, sequence diagrams and similar documentation
* Design, build and deploy Distributed Web Applications, Services, Cloud Infrastructure configurations, and Cloud Platform configurations
* Collaborate with business partners and team members to propose solutions
* Support other staff in researching and resolving application issues
* Monitor application telemetry, errors, traces, uploads and system batch jobs for issues, then propose and implement solutions
* Perform other duties as assigned

QUALIFICATIONS

* 5 Years of experience writing or maintaining distributed customer-facing web applications
* 2 Years of experience with an enterprise .Net-based WCMS. Examples include: Sitecore, Ektron, or EPiServer
* 2 Years of experience participating in the implementation of marketing or e-commerce systems

If you are comfortable being in the thick of things working with developers, project leads and project stakeholders to understand and resolve issues and clarify requirements this is a great opportunity. About this job

Technologies

.net

Job description

We're looking for a strong, Kentico developer based anywhere in Latin America who works well participating on 100% distributed teams and is interested in driving intelligent content and driving exceptional digital experiences.

We prize our ability to consult clients on the strategic use of digital experience management technology.  Most of our implementations typically involve some type of integration with third party services, so the ability to think creatively to leverage the strengths of the CMS/EMS to make seamless integrations possible is a key requirement. We are looking for somebody able to architect and build content management and multi-channel marketing solutions for clients and our agency partners.

This is a remote job that can be done from anywhere in Latin America. Please do not apply if you do not have Kentico platform experience.

What you’ll be doing

  • Develop technical specifications based on functional requirements
  • Work with structured content, data template definition and inheritance / content engineering (content modeling, metadata, schema, taxonomy)
  • Develop presentation components
  • Collaborate efficiently with teammates to identify problems and solutions in working toward completion of project goal
  • Direct architecture for security, performance, scale, ux, analytics, optimization
  • Develop integrations to external services and software
  • Author and/or perform tests according to a given test plan and documents results
  • Perform basic debugging in test and production environments
  • Maintain and repair existing properties
  • Kentico version upgrades
  • Run, maintain agile projects and tickets backlog in JIRA
  • Help facilitate smooth DevOps
  • Collaborate, learn, teach
  • Staying in constant communication with team members via Slack.

You may be a good match for this role if:

  • Experienced in Kentico  (4+ years)
  • Experienced in C#, ASP.NET, .NET MVC, MSSQL Server
  • A great verbal and written communicator
  • In-depth knowledge of IIS and Azure is preferred
  • Experience in modern front-end development techniques, including HTML5, CSS3. Modern JS frameworks such as React or Angular are a plus.
  • Familiarity with build tools/task runners e.g. Gulp or Webpack is a plus
  • Experience with CI and automated deployment tools e.g. TeamCity, Octopus is a plus
  • Proven hands-on contributor who can think outside the box.

What is [A]?

At its simplest, [A] is a distributed technology consulting company in the United States that focuses on content engineering and content management systems integration. We simplify complex technology for agencies and institutional clients. We focus content engineering and content technology, but our [A]gents are multi-talented and get called upon to deliver consulting, application development, architecture and strategy.
 

What’s Your Name, [A]gain?

Our name is easy. Just say “A.” The [A] brackets represent markup, microdata, content intelligence. The letter “[A]” represents the start, initiation, beginning of change. We are going to help change the world with intelligent content.

Learn more about [A] at simplea.com.

Apply now

About [A]

[A] is the Content Intelligence Service.

[A] is a distributed, private, professional services firm that provides strategic support for building content intelligence practices into organizations. [A] helps complex organizations establish content engineering standards and practices to compete in a multichannel, multimodal, AI-driven world.

[A] engineers intelligent content systems for CMS/CEM platforms, and offers integration, training, workshops and custom development. [A] helps clients value content as an enterprise asset, and enables future-ready content through use of the Master Content Model.

What’s Your Name, [A]gain?

Our name is easy. Just say “A.” The [A] brackets represent markup, microdata, content intelligence. The letter “[A]” represents the start, initiation, beginning of change. We are going to help change the world with intelligent content.

Cultural Fit at [A]

  • You love learning, you love teaching.
  • You enjoy wearing multiple hats and roles, and titles are not important to you.
  • You do top-quality work, manage quality, and make everything you touch better.
  • You are comfortable working under strict confidentiality agreements and often behind-the-scenes.
  • You are self-organized and manage time and resources well.
  • You work alone well but communicate well within a team.

[A] Team Benefits

Being an [A]gent comes with its benefits. Work from anywhere. Advance your career on the leading-edge of the content and technology sciences. Earn a competitive salary, and for longtime [A]gents, participation in a profit-sharing plan. But many [A]gents find the best part of working as an [A]gent are the other [A]gents you work with and the culture at [A].

We take care of each other and we honor each other's work and contributions to the team. We work to make ourselves better and our [A] team better. We make efforts to adapt new technologies and methodologies that can help us optimize our time, and we expect you to collaborate on these efforts if you’re an expert on any of those fields. We communicate and reach out to other [A] players.  We love learning. We love teaching. We write. We code. We support each other. For the right people, working at [A] feels like coming home. 

Benefits

  • Competitive salary

tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=79, c=8, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=10, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=16}
items.content:
Back-End Engineer at We Are Mammoth

Remote | Freelance

REMOTE · Chicago, Illinois, United States

DESCRIPTION

We Are Mammoth is looking for a contract junior-level .NET/C# software engineer with at least two years of professional experience to help us with a major SQL server migration project for a period of 14-16 weeks.

We are a 100% remote team working throughout the United States. Our new engineer must be based in the United States, be a U.S. citizen, and be willing to work the same structured daily schedule with our team (regular business hours of 9AM – 5PM Central time).

As a junior-level engineer, you should have at least two years of experience writing clean, well tested, server side code as part of a full web application. You should also have a basic proficiency and be comfortable working with HTML, CSS and JavaScript. You and one other junior-level developer will work on this project under the leadership of a senior back-end developer.

While we’re looking for a junior-level engineer, you need to be a senior-level team player, communicator, and problem solver. Since we are all remote, we communicate through Slack, Basecamp, and video chats throughout the day. You must be able to express your ideas and needs clearly. Everyone on our team also speaks directly with our clients on a daily basis, mostly in writing. You must be able to explain technical concepts to non-technical people thoughtfully, and you must be able to work and communicate with a diverse range of people.

As a junior-level back-end engineer, here are some things you might do in a typical week:

  • Be responsible for 2-3 server migration projects at a time, all at varying degrees of completion.
  • Be comfortable learning and maintaining legacy code bases.
  • Investigate and resolve 15-20 reported bugs.
  • Make updates to a SQL server database schema using our in-house data modeling tool, X2O.
  • Provide well-written messages to a client in Basecamp about the current status and upcoming roadmap for a particular site implementation.
  • Routinely provide detailed insight to a client explaining how you’ve implemented a piece of logic that they’ve specified to resolve a bug.
  • Managing a codebase and committing changes to a central SVN repository, including merging branches, or occasionally resolving code conflicts with other developers.
  • Work with a project manager to estimate projection completion
  • Gain more business domain knowledge of how benefits and retirement plans work, as you continue to implement more code for a client. You’ll use this knowledge to become even more productive and valuable for future projects.
  • Perform scheduled code, database schema, and data migrations to various environments.
  • Respond to issues discovered in a dynamic and static scan of existing code bases.

REQUIREMENTS

All of our developers here have experience in the following, in order of how often you’ll be using these languages/patterns:

  • .NET / C# using the MVC framework
  • SQL
  • Relational DB development
  • Service-repository pattern and dependency injection
  • SSIS
  • Unit and regression testing
  • jQuery/Javascript
  • HTML/CSS

To be successful in this contract position, the right junior-level developer will also have the following:

  • Experience with MicroSoft SQL Server and related tools
  • Experience with database structures, stored procedures, functions, triggers, data migration and transformation
  • Experience with .NET C#, dependency injection, Web API and other .NET related development
  • Experience with SSIS and data transformation
  • Experience with Redgate Data Tools
  • Experience with Windows Tasks, Powershell and automation tools

BENEFITS

We Are Mammoth is a close-knit, hard working team of eleven software developers, designers, technical project managers, and support staff.

This is a contract position, and the project you’ll be working on is estimated to last between 13-16 weeks. During this time, you’ll enjoy the following benefits:

  • Competitive pay
  • 3 paid days off + any company holidays that are within the duration of the project
  • All new team members at We Are Mammoth are paired with a mentor who provides advice, guidance, and support.

This is a full-time contract for 14-16 weeks, remote, junior-level .NET/C# engineer position. We Are Mammoth promotes a workplace that actively seeks to include, welcome, and value unique contributions of all people. We encourage all qualified US Citizens to apply for this job.

Apply for job

items.content:
RESPONSIBILITIES:
Kforce has a client in Phoenix, Arizona (AZ) that is seeking a Senior Full Stack Software Engineer for a remote position.

Duties:
* Works on problems of diverse scope where analysis of data requires evaluation of identifiable factors
* Demonstrates good judgement in selecting methods and techniques for obtaining solutions
* Networks with senior internal and external personnel in own area of expertise
* This position is responsible for the development and maintenance of various Cloud and .NET related applications across business units
* This position will contribute to the development, enhancement and maintenance of new and existing software solutions utilizing industry best practices in accordance with the organizations development lifecycle (SLDC) methodology; The development is focused on cloud solutions using Angular, MVC, ASP.NET and Azure services
* Participate in the review, design, development, implementation and maintenance of Cloud based and backend solutions, systems and applications
* Analyze requirements and prepare detailed technical design documents
* Perform unit testing and complex debugging
* Participate in production releases and troubleshoot production issues
* Interact with and collaborate across diverse teams consisting of technical and non-technical personnel
* Document designs, processes, work instructions, etc.
* Lead external partner development and QA resources
* Will have the ability to work remotely
* Arizona residents only

REQUIREMENTS:
* Minimum of 5-8 years of related software development experience with a Bachelor's degree; or 3-4 years and a Master's degree; or a PhD without experience; or equivalent work experience
* Web development skills in newer versions of Angular, TypeScript, ASP.NET MVC, jQuery, RESTful API
* Experience building and maintaining solutions hosted in MS Azure is a plus
* Should have experience with SQL
* Experience writing unit tests using MS Test and Jasmine frameworks or similar frameworks is preferred
* .NET Core (it is okay if they only have .NET experience with core is just preferred)
* Microservices experience is a plus (team leader says this is a nice to have but not necessary)
* Experience coding on the customer side and not just in house
* Full stack experience is a plus but will be focusing more on the front-end
* Angular is a must
* React experience is a major plus
* They want candidates with public facing web solutions experience
* Should have used source control and should be exposed to continuous integration principles
* Should have worked in Agile mode

Kforce is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, protected veteran status, or disability status.

- provided by Dice

C# DEVELOPER

Immediate need for a .NET Developer to help with new development and legacy conversion to C# .NET. Applicants must have experience in the design, development, and unit testing of .NET applications. The most important qualifications will be the willingness to learn, a strong commitment to quality, excellent communication skills and the ability to work on their own as well as with a team!

Responsibilities:

  • Work as part of an agile development team to write C# code for enterprise systems.
  • Ability to work independently without direct supervision.
  • Design in collaboration with a team to satisfy business requirements.
  • Collaborate with product owners on requirements gathering and refinement.
  • Participate in knowledge sharing activities with colleagues.
  • On occasion, the availability to work modified shifts.

Technical Experience / Education:

  • Minimum 3 years of C# developer experience.
  • Experience with intermediate to advanced SQL.
  • A Bachelor s Degree in Engineering, Computer Science or related field is preferred.
  • Equivalent combination of knowledge and specialized experience may be acceptable in lieu of a degree.
  • Experience with agile development methodologies.
  • Experience with unit testing.
  • Experience with web browser technologies such as ASP.NET, MVC, HTML 5, JavaScript, jQuery, CSS, AJAX.
  • Experience with web site setup and maintenance in IIS 7+.
  • Experience with source control systems (TFS or other system).

Company Benefits:

  • 401(k) Plan with company match
  • Medical/Dental/Vision Benefits
  • Life and Disability Insurance

Physical Demands and Work Environment:

The physical demands and work environment characteristics described here are representative of those an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of the job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

Employee will occasionally need to lift or move equipment weighing up to 15 pounds. Dexterity of hands and fingers to operate a computer keyboard. Hearing and speaking to exchange information. Seeing to view computer monitor. Sitting for extended periods of time.

Professional office environment: temperature controlled office building, low noise level, standard office lighting.

Work from Home Requirements:

If working from home, you ll need to provide:

  • A quiet and uninterrupted workspace (no background noises which could hinder customer or employee interactions)
  • Broadband internet connection. (Minimum 25 mbps download and 10 mbps upload)
  • Connection to the router/modem via a wired ethernet port.

Collaborate with team members on coding decisions

I am working with an exciting global tech firm, providing services to some of largest global financial institutions. They are looking for talented .NET Developers that would be interested in the opportunity to relocate and join their core development team in the Czech Republic (Brno).

For those who haven’t visited the Czech Republic before, it’s an opportunity to enjoy a high standard of living and a comfortable lifestyle in country that enjoys a low cost of living.

The role will involve designing, building and maintaining a range of dynamic financial trading platforms for an external client base, which includes some of the most recognisable names in the Financial Services sector. The tech stack includes ASP.NET, C#, MVC, JavaScript and SQL Server.

Ideally, the .NET Developer will be confident using the above tech to write high quality applications, as well as the ability to communicate with stakeholders to translate requirements.

This is a role that would require the .NET Developer to be based onsite in the Czech Republic, there is not an option for remote work.

The financial package is up to 1,080,000CZK annually (a shade under £40,000) and a relocation package is available, this includes flights, accommodation and a relocation fee.

If you’re a developer that is open to a relocation, please get in touch as I can provide the full details of the company and the package. Please contact Tom IT.

Apply for job

tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=8, c=0, mobile=6, go=3, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=6, java=1, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=8}
items.content:
Voipfone

Mobile Desktop App Developer


STRICTLY NO RECRUITMENT AGENCIES

We are looking for an experienced mobile and desktop application developer to join us for exciting new projects. The role involves designing and implementing mobile and desktop applications that integrate with our telecoms platform through open standards, as well as proprietary APIs. The emphasis will be on providing clean, functional and friendly user interfaces, while maintaining a robust design.

Our ideal candidate is a software developer with a lot of attention to detail and who takes pride in writing clean code. If you find yourself mentally processing corner cases as you go through a design, then this is a sure sign we would be very interested to hear from you. The ambition to learn new things and continuously improve is a requirement. We are looking for someone to join us for the long term in providing the best possibles services to our customers.

Voipfone runs a virtual office, meaning all our employees work from home (09:00 to 17:30 UK time), so self-motivation and reliability are essential qualities. We will supply all the computer equipment, telephony and Internet services required, and you must have a secure and quiet space in your home from which to work.

Benefits


* Home Based Role

* Company Profit Share (not capped)

* Performance Based Bonus

* Free Telecoms Services

* Free Broadband

* Full 1 hour lunch

* 33 days Holiday

* Holiday Buy Back Scheme

* Well Days Incentive Scheme

* Day off on your birthday (or nearest working day)

* Supplied equipment including iMac and iPhone




Responsibilities

You will be reporting to and working closely with the Systems Architect in the design phases of the projects. You will need to familiarise yourself with our telecoms platform and the features it provides, as well as the open standards (SIP and related technologies) on which it is built, and work mostly independently on implementing the software solutions you helped to shape.

You will be involved in the full life-cycle of the projects, from design to release and ongoing maintenance. You will be responsible for writing documentation, as well as liaising with colleagues in the support teams to ensure end-users are provided with the best possible experience.

Requirements

Given the nature of the projects you’ll be working on, you will require a good understanding of the following:


* Programming GUIs

* Cross-platform development

* iOS development

* Android development

* macOS development

* Windows development




While not essential, the following skills would certainly prove useful:


* An eye for GUI design

* Experience with frameworks such as React Native

* Git version control

* Knowledge of various network protocols

* SIP




STRICTLY NO RECRUITMENT AGENCIES

Apply now

About Voipfone

iNet Telecoms® Ltd (Voipfone) is a UK company founded in 2004 to develop innovative Internet Telephone Services using the technologies of VoIP - Voice over Internet Protocols.

We're a fast growing, profitable and multi-award winning company (including the 2013 Queens Award for Enterprise) with an interesting business model - we're a fully virtual company, all our employees work remotely using our own products and services. 

We believe in providing no nonsense, but sophisticated, services with transparent and honest pricing and a very high level of reliability and support.

We're a technology company and we develop our services ourselves, in-house. This means that we can create new and customised services quickly and do many things that most others can’t.

We do not advertise, do not resell and do not have a sales force. We grow by word of mouth and reputation alone.

Because we're innovators in VoIP and are one of the founders of the VoIP industry in the UK, Voipfone has been featured in many media over the years - newspaper and magazine articles and on TV and radio. You can see a selection here. 

Voipfone is a founder member of ITSPA - the trade organisation for Internet Telephony in the UK - and hold its quality mark.

items.content:
RESPONSIBILITIES:
Kforce has a client in Phoenix, Arizona (AZ) that is seeking a Senior Full Stack Software Engineer for a remote position.

Duties:
* Works on problems of diverse scope where analysis of data requires evaluation of identifiable factors
* Demonstrates good judgement in selecting methods and techniques for obtaining solutions
* Networks with senior internal and external personnel in own area of expertise
* This position is responsible for the development and maintenance of various Cloud and .NET related applications across business units
* This position will contribute to the development, enhancement and maintenance of new and existing software solutions utilizing industry best practices in accordance with the organizations development lifecycle (SLDC) methodology; The development is focused on cloud solutions using Angular, MVC, ASP.NET and Azure services
* Participate in the review, design, development, implementation and maintenance of Cloud based and backend solutions, systems and applications
* Analyze requirements and prepare detailed technical design documents
* Perform unit testing and complex debugging
* Participate in production releases and troubleshoot production issues
* Interact with and collaborate across diverse teams consisting of technical and non-technical personnel
* Document designs, processes, work instructions, etc.
* Lead external partner development and QA resources
* Will have the ability to work remotely
* Arizona residents only

REQUIREMENTS:
* Minimum of 5-8 years of related software development experience with a Bachelor's degree; or 3-4 years and a Master's degree; or a PhD without experience; or equivalent work experience
* Web development skills in newer versions of Angular, TypeScript, ASP.NET MVC, jQuery, RESTful API
* Experience building and maintaining solutions hosted in MS Azure is a plus
* Should have experience with SQL

items.content:
RESPONSIBILITIES:
Kforce has a client that is seeking a Principal Cloud Software Developer in Phoenix, Arizona (AZ).

Summary:
As Principal Cloud Software Engineer, you will help lead a team of developers building enterprise software targeting Cloud Native Azure PaaS services, providing online transaction processing in a SaaS environment and playing an integral role in the success of the product delivery and quality. You will work with your technical peers to understand and implement functionality for new solutions. You will analyze problems and implement solutions that trade off architectural constraints of functionality, usability, performance, reliability, and scalability. You will develop and modify REST APIs using C# frameworks in a high-volume transaction processing n-tier distributed environment.

Additionally, you will design and implement modern web-based user interfaces using best practices to support new functionality (HTML5/JS), new databases and other forms of storage to persist application data, services and applications. You will support the life cycle of the application development integration testing, user acceptance testing, and post release. You will also comply with and contribute to consistent development activities including, coding/change control/build/versioning, code reviews, design sessions, stand-ups, sprint demos, etc.

Key Tasks:
* End to end testing, Postman, building frameworks using postman
* Look at the end to end of it to ensure the quality behind the functionality
* Ability to work from home

REQUIREMENTS:
* BS or Master's in CS preferred, but at least a Bachelor's in Computer Science/Tech focus or similar field
* A minimum of 7-15+ years proven experience with large complex system implementations/integrations
* 5+ years of proven experience in web technologies including microservice patterns/architecture, high availability, scalability and cloud native solutions developed on Azure, AWS or GCP; Experience building PaaS solutions preferred
* 5+ years of Azure experience, ok if they have previous tech experience
* Experience developing applications for Azure, AWS, Google, or other cloud platforms for large-scale, multi-tenant SaaS systems is desired
* Must have cloud data development using AZURE PAAS - target native applications- that have tons of detail
* Fluent with one or more programming languages; C#, JavaScript, NoSQL technologies, experience with Java or Microsoft frameworks
* Has experience with Microsoft SQL Server or similar relational database platform
* Experience with NoSQL databases like Cosmos DB, Mongo, Cassandra, or other highly-scalable solutions are plusses
* Has a deep understanding of object-oriented programming, design patterns like Inversion of Control, and solid object-oriented principles
* Is proficient with service-oriented architectures, with focused experience developing Microservices
* Has experience with Docker and/or Kubernetes-based CI/CD lifecycles and pipelines
* Has experience with one or more source
* CLOUD Native Development is key
* Heads down development (using the latest facilities within the Azure portfolio)

Kforce is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, protected veteran status, or disability status.

- provided by Dice

items.content:
Ascendle

 

Senior Developer


If you have 5-7 years of development experience and are ready to start leading teams, this job is for you!

Ascendle is a contract software engineering firm specializing in using the Microsoft stack to build web and native mobile apps (using Xamarin) for our growing client base. We're looking for a .NET Senior Developer to join our team. You will be instrumental in keeping our offshore developers moving quickly and cranking out high-quality code.

In this role, you'll be the one "making sure we build the software right," providing strategic guidance and oversight to offshore software engineers located in Eastern Europe. This is not a day to day tactical coding role. This is a strategic role where you'll leverage your experience to help more junior software engineers perform at the top of their game.

Responsibilities include:


* Work closely with the Product Owner on the project to understand the overall vision of the product.

* Perform technical research to determine how to accomplish application business goals, for example, third-party APIs, open-source plugins, JavaScript libraries, etc.

* Have developers create small research projects when necessary to prove out new concepts and ideas.

* Write a high-level technical implementation strategy when developers need specific guidance for a new story. This is typically a one- to two-page document in the project Wiki that describes classes, interfaces, unit tests, etc. This is designed to help the developers avoid going down a wrong path and speed up their work.

* Answer technical developer questions and help them solve problems.

* Perform code reviews to ensure software engineers are attaining proper code coverage, writing code to our standards, and implementing architectural patterns consistent with our approach.




This is a role for a dynamic individual who has lots of software development experience but does not want to be heads-down cutting production code. Again, this is not a coding role; it's a strategic oversight and mentoring role.

Our teams work virtually. You must be located within an hour from Portsmouth, NH or Boston, MA as you'll need to be available once per week at client locations. 

The ideal candidate will have experience with the following technologies and techniques:


* Test-driven development (TDD)

* Standard design patterns/Gang of Four

* ASP.NET Core 2 and RESTful APIs

* Angular 2 and later and/or React

* Git and Git Flow

* Azure

* NUnit

* Jasmine and Karma

* NSubstitute, Moq or similar isolation framework

* Bitbucket Pipelines, Bamboo, Jenkins, Azure Deployment, or similar CI/CD tools

* Microservices technologies such as Docker, Kubernetes, and Azure Kubernetes Service (AKS)




TO APPLY:
To apply, please upload your resume along with a cover letter detailing your interest and related experience to the position, and your compensation requirements. Ascendle requires the completion of a background check upon offer of employment.

items.content:
Summary of Opportunity

We are seeking a Senior Software Developer to become an integral part of our team! The primary purpose of this role is to perform Specification, Design, Coding, Testing and Documentation in order to develop and maintain our Software as a Service platform. You will take mission critical projects through the entire Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC) using the latest technologies to apply them in both existing and new applications used by our customers all over the country. This will include both server-side and client-side development, maintenance of intranet/extranet software, and messaging systems to multiple external integration points. We are heavy on web apps, analytics, workflow, and EDI using C# in .NET and our HIPAA compliant cloud platform.

Construction of the solution requires familiarity with the application, database, network, security, infrastructure, and virtualization. We have internally grown frameworks as well as mainstream structures (AngularJS, JQuery, JMS/JORAM, JSON, DWR, HTML4/5, etc.). Our development architecture is fast-pace and keeps up with cutting-edge technologies. Other efforts will include development & maintenance of SQL scripts, automation scripts, build scripts, and small amount of client technical support. Must be a self-starter able to independently drive a project to completion. Must be proficient at finding optimal solutions to technical challenges throughout the entire SDLC.

Open to telecommute with some travel, DOQ.
Candidates must be authorized to work in the U.S. without sponsorship. No visa sponsorship/transfer available for this position.
Employment is contingent upon a successful background check and drug screen.

Qualifications Skill Set

  • Exceptional experience, knowledge and skill with C# in .NET is essential
  • Advanced working experience with C# .NET technologies Object Oriented Programming, RDBMS and Visual Studio IDE a plus
  • College degree in computer/software related field desired. Background in all relevant aspects of object-oriented system development required.
  • Strong experience with healthcare EDI transactions (X12), especially with the X,835 messaging standards a plus
  • Strong organizational and time management skills
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
  • Excellent analytic skills.
  • Detail oriented.
  • Ability to multi-task and independently drive a project to completion
  • Ability to work with confidential information
  • Previous experience in a professional healthcare setting or supporting electronic medical records is desired.
  • Business-related training in a customer service environment preferred, but not required.
  • Preferred 5+ years of experience designing and developing web based and mobile applications and web services unless the applicant can demonstrate outstanding proficiency in the absence of such experience
  • Strong Object-Oriented development experience

Working Here

Our goals are to provide excellent service, utilize advanced technology, and proficiently deliver results. To accomplish these goals, we constantly seek individuals who look for ways to do things better. We are a company whose culture cultivates teamwork, rewards excellence, focuses on quality for every aspect of our business and promotes community involvement. We are looking for individuals who can grow with our company. We offer a comprehensive benefits package (PTO, Medical, Dental, Vision, Life, Short- and Long-Term Disability, 401(k) and Stock Options) along with competitive compensation.

Who We Are

Mediture is a leading provider of healthcare software that supports the mission of helping elderly and vulnerable populations stay in their home. Mediture software solutions facilitate care management, benefit plan management, and financial oversight in capitated healthcare markets. Mediture TruChart Health Plan Management, Electronic Health Record, and Analytics solutions empowers organizations to track measurable outcomes to support the specific needs of the population they serve. Based in Eden Prairie, MN, Mediture has a national client base delivering care for populations with complex healthcare needs. As a driven team, Mediture works to deliver solutions that solve customers' challenges and support vulnerable populations.


#DICE

Job Summary

My client is a software house that builds applications for the online gaming industry, They are currently looking to grow their exisiting development team with a talented .NET Developer.

If you're a developer that would like the option for part remote working, this will be available for up to 4 days per week (depending on location and business requirements). Alongside this, the team enjoy a great culture and benefits like flexible working hours and regular hackathons.

You will collaborate with the team to design, build and maintain a range of dynamic web, mobile and desktop applications for a clients within the gaming and gambling industry. This role will mainly focus on back-end engineering, but you'd be welcome to work full-stack if you wished.

Ideal Skillset

Required

  • .NET Core
  • SQL Server/T-SQL
  • HTML/CSS/JavaScript
  • Agile Methodology

Desirable

  • Exposure to Winforms/WPF
  • Experience with Multi-Threading and N-Tier Applications

Further Information

If you wish to apply for this role, please forward your updated CV. If you would like more information about this opportunity, please contact Tom IT.

Please note that my client is unable to offer any form of Visa Sponsorship

items.content:
Senior C# Developer

About this job

Job type: Full-time
Experience level: Senior, Lead
Role: Full Stack Developer
Industry: Developer APIs, Hospitality, SaaS
Company size: 11–50 people
Company type: Private
Company: Impala | No office location

Remote details

Preferred Timezone: (GMT+00:00) London +/- 2 hours

Technologies

c#
rest
sql-server
oracle

Job description

Our market leading hospitality API platform is partially powered by a remote Data Reader that extracts data from a system and securely transmits it back to Impala to be parsed and made available via our API.

As a Senior C# Developer, you'll:

  • Work as the lead developer of our Data Reader product within our engineering team. You'll
    also have the opportunity to contribute to other areas of our codebase depending on your interests and experience.
  • Participate in building and maintaining logging and monitoring solutions to ensure the continued
    functioning of Data Reader instances.
  • Collaborate with our product team to suggest and design new features to improve security,
    usability and reliability of the Data Reader.
  • Mentor other team members through pair programming, code reviews, and ad-hoc assistance.

What we're looking for:

  • An experienced C# developer, with proven success deploying and maintaining production services.
  • Someone who is comfortable working on greenfield projects, drawing on experience to choose
    technologies that suit the projects requirements.
  • Knowledge of unit and integration testing tools and techniques.
  • Experience working with SQL databases such as MSSQL and Oracle.
  • Someone who avoids over-engineering of solutions and understands how to maintain a high-quality of code in a delivery-focused environment.

What would make you stand out:

  • Experience packaging and deploying C# services in an automated fashion, especially including automatic updates.
  • Javascript knowledge. Experience with React and/or Node is even better.
  • Knowledge of AWS, CircleCI, Docker, Terraform, Git.
  • Experience working within a remote team.
Apply now

About Impala

Impala is a team of eleven incredibly talented, helpful and outgoing individuals (plus one more modest individual that wrote this job post) all working remotely within -2/+2 GMT. We’re a diverse team that puts building a great product and being happy at work as our two guiding principles. We're also very well funded by industry leading investors.

We're also a remote company, and you will be able to either work from home or from a co-working office, within the UK or mainland Europe.

  • A competitive salary and equity based on experience.
  • Frequent socials.
  • Flexible working hours.
  • The ability to work remotely.
  • Time dedicated every Friday afternoon for personal projects, lightning talks and team events.
  • A monthly allowance for books and other educational materials.
  • The opportunity to work alongside a tight knit and driven team.

Where we differ is:

  • You'll be working in a company led by an engineer. You won't be asked to do the unrealistic and your skills will be tested and improved.
  • You'll be working in a company that puts professional development front and centre.
  • You'll have a demonstrable, strong role in product direction.
  • We have an incredible culture and community.

Benefits

  • Remote work possible
  • Pick your own gear
  • Genuine product involvement
  • Lots of opportunities for travel
  • State of the art office space
  • Flexible holiday/working time

Job description

items.content:
Senior Full Stack Developer at TITAN School Solutions

Remote

Location: Irvine, CA
Job ID: 168
# of Openings: 1

Titan School Solutions is an EdTech startup that is on the fast track for growth and is changing the face of school nutrition. Our SaaS platform is recognized in the space for bringing state-of-the art efficiencies and real-time transparency into schools, all while remaining focused on the bigger outcome – helping K-12 students. Titan’s founders are school information technology veterans who have not only created a scalable and affordable solution but have also brought value into schools by delivering real results.

As we continue to sky rocket within this industry, we need a hands-on Sr. Full Stack Developer that can help scale Titan’s platform. We’re looking for a someone who can see the larger opportunities within a startup, create more with less, face a problem head-on, and do it all while executing on engineering vision and code.

If you are a highly energetic self-starter with the ability to steer a team toward success and ultimately want to be part of transforming an institutional enterprise… KEEP READING!

This position is available for remote employment in the United States and does require the team member to be on call

WHERE YOU WILL BE IN A YEAR:

  • TRANSFORM AN INDUSTRY! – You will impact an antiquated industry that is ready for disruption. You will build and change the way school data is stored, utilized and used by students across the country.
  • ACCELERATE YOUR CAREER! – You will be involved in an industry that is unlike any other. You will manage, code and improve an already existing high traffic system while working in a fast-paced field that will expand your horizons and put you far above your peers.
  • DRIVE TECHNICAL IMPROVEMENTS! You will help evaluate the technical direction for teams and projects throughout the organization.

WHAT YOU’LL DO:

  • Hands-on development of senior-level tasks such as the creation of complex features and platforms, optimization and refactoring of existing code…and everything in between.
  • Bring your Full-Stack web expertise and have an impact across all layers (web client, API, database…and everything in between) of a robust and scalable platform.
  • Create standards for both existing and new technology by researching and integrating various frameworks and tooling as well as documenting their usage in the platform.
  • Partner with other engineering teams, departments, and stakeholders to align on broader engineering and company initiatives.
  • Maintain a high bar for code quality through code reviews, standards creation, and documentation.
  • Manage code dependencies, optimize the build process and streamline task automation from development to production.
  • Foster and embody our values of teamwork, lifelong learning, trust, empowerment, and quality through a people-first management philosophy.

WHAT YOU’LL NEED TO GET THERE:

  • Experience developing highly scalable and performant production REST API driven web applications using the ASP.NET (C#) and SQL Server tech stack.
  • Experience with a modern JavaScript Framework (AngularJS and Angular is strongly preferred).
  • Proficiency in Vanilla JavaScript and/or TypeScript
  • Strong experience using responsive web frameworks and CSS
  • Experience with unit/integration test frameworks and tooling such as NUnit/XUnit, Mocha/Jasmine and Postman is strongly preferred
  • Experience with .NET Core and Full Framework
  • Excellent communication skills, capable of conveying complex systems and logic to both technical and non-technical audiences.
  • A thirst for learning and a passion for new technologies, processes and patterns.
  • Experience working with large-scale distributed architecture is a plus.
  • A passion to help engineers develop new skills and advance in their careers.
  • A drive to continuously improve both the team and the product.
  • Our stack: ASP.NET, WebAPI, MVC, Hangfire, C#, SQL Server 2017, Redis, Google Cloud Platform, Git, Angular, Vue.js, and Entity Framework

WHAT WE OFFER
At Titan School Solutions, we’re looking for bright, independent, self-motivated, and experienced people who have an entrepreneurial spirit and passion for technology. Our compensation packages consist of salary and a full suite of benefits to support our growing team. Titan offers all of the opportunity that comes with a startup, without the risk. It is backed by Cie, a startup accelerator, and Wavemaker Partners, a venture capital firm.

  • Competitive salary: Based on experience and performance.
  • Health/Benefits: Medical, Dental, & Visual. 95% paid by employer!
  • Unlimited PTO: We believe in work/life balance to reward are rock stars for delivering great results.
  • The Right Gear: All the bells and whistles you need to drive results.
  • 401k Matching: We offer a generous 401k plan and we match 100% up to 5%.
  • Ownership: You’ll be a crucial member of the initial build-out team, offering unlimited opportunity for growth and professional development.
Apply for job
