items.content:
Job Title: .Net Engineer III

Location: Denver, CO

Duration: 6 Months (Possibility of extension)

Contract: W2

Pay Rate: $70 - $75/hr W2

Job Description:

Candidates will be able to work remotely and will only need to be in the office 5-10% of the time for meetings only. The kicker with this position is the work hours. This person will need to be available for a daily call with the Manila team at 10am Philippine Standard Time which is 8:00pm MST (Denver time). The candidates can work flex hours to accommodate that meeting.... that could look like 12pm - 9pm MST or they can work normal Denver hours as long as they are available for that 8pm MST.

The Role
Member of a highly autonomous development team observing agile methodologies and principles.
Demonstrate solution understanding through visual and collaborative means, such as diagramming and brainstorming.
Write maintainable, resilient, secure, and testable codes.
Integrate software units and components into a fully functional software system.
Involvement in code reviews for peers and/or junior team members.
Working as a team to produce and deliver high quality results.
Troubleshoot and debug existing codes and learn the solution footprints.
Continuously learn state-of-the-art development tools and programming techniques.
Advocate continuous delivery mindset across the release cycles. Embrace, implement and evangelize automation.
Adhere to key non-functional requirements, namely performance and security.
Actively participate on estimation and planning and comply to agreed project timelines.


The Requirements
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or similar technical discipline
Web Development Experience Building and Running Large Scale, Production Web Sites.
Professional Experience with ASP.NET, MVC, Web APIs, C#, and the .NET Framework.
Professional Experience using popular web formats such as HTML5, JSON, XML, and CSS.
Solid foundation and experience in Object-Oriented Programming.
Well-versed in Microsoft Tools and Technology Stack (i.e. Visual Studio, VS Code)
Database Applied knowledge in SQL. Ability to write performant SQL statements. Ability to diagnose SQL statements with high complexity.
Performance Tuning - Comprehensive experience and tooling in ensuring responsiveness of web applications.
Debugging - Ability to profile, debug, and diagnose highly complex codes.
Information Security - Understanding and implementation of security and data protection (i.e. OWASP).
Unit Testing Advocate and hands-on experience of building automated unit tests and exposure to variety of its patterns.
Continuous Delivery Direct exposure in leveraging Continuous Integration/Continuous Delivery Pipeline (i.e. TeamCity / MSBuild / AzureDevOps).
Relevant experience in conveying technical solutions and able to translate its business value to stakeholders.
Up-to-date to latest technologies. Eagerness to learn new technologies and passionate about building world-class software.
Worked with globally distributed business stakeholders and engineering teams.
Experience working with collaboration and issue tracking tools such as Confluence and JIRA.
Experience working in a large, fast-paced project environment.
Has gained exposure to Agile Software Development Methodologies (i.e. Scrum)

Desirable Skills
Professional Experience with popular UI libraries such as Typescript and Angular.
Web grid COTS experience such as Wijmo, ag-grid, Telerik or any other.
Prior experience refactoring and supporting legacy apps.
Job/worker frameworks such as Hangfire
Deep understanding of SPROC coding in Oracle and SQL Server
Understanding of SSIS packages and how to construct them.
Experience with SignalR

- provided by Dice

REMOTE Option available.

Job Description:
Unfortunately at this time, we cannot sponsor or transfer work Visas. Please only apply if you are eligible to work in the US without sponsorship.

Description:
We are looking for a Delphi Developer who can become a key contributor within our Product Development Team. This role involves developing new products as well as enhancing and maintaining our existing software. Responsibilities of this role also include translating software requirements into concise and accurate code and being able to work productively in a cross-departmental team environment.


Requirements:



  • BS degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or related degree.
  • 1-5 years' experience working in Delphi, C#, and SQL Server.
  • Experience with the latest .NET technologies.
  • Expertise in object oriented design and modeling.
  • Strong analytical and problem solving skills and the ability to provide solutions for complex problems and challenges.

  • Experience developing and executing automated unit tests.
  • Ability to work with customers and internal business analysts.
  • Experience with continuous integration, source control, and build tools.
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills.

This position can be filled at various levels depending on experience.



Don't delay. Join the Software Resources team today!
Software Resources specializes in connecting talented IT professionals with challenging job opportunities that transform jobs into careers.
To meet our clients hiring needs, we continuously source talented IT Professionals with all levels of expertise and in all disciplines. We offer world class major medical, dental and vision benefits, 401(k) with match, short term disability, Life Insurance and AD&D. You, our future employees, can make a tremendous difference to our company and our clients. Please apply to this job and experience the Software Resources difference. You can view all of our jobs at
Company Overview
Software Resources specializes in IT talent recruitment services and workforce staffing solutions. Founded in 1992 as an IT staffing services firm, we are a privately held women-owned business enterprise (WBE), celebrating our 25th year in business. We are headquartered in Lake Mary, Florida, just outside of Orlando. With branches and sales professionals throughout the U.S., Software Resources is the staffing agency of choice for clients and consultants.
We specialize in IT. It's what we do and what we know, every day. We provide contract, contract to hire and direct hire placement IT staffing solutions for Energy, Entertainment/Gaming/New Media, Financial Services, Government, Healthcare, Hospitality, Professional Services, and Security.

items.content:
Intelligent Editing

Employee No. 5 Senior .NET Web Developer


We produce software for editing/proofreading. As Intelligent Editing’s employee number five, you’ll have a wide set of responsibilities and the opportunity to contribute across as much of the business as interests you. You’ll take charge of our e-commerce, website, web applications, web integrations, and analytics. Our audience are (mostly) not technologists, so you’ll make the complicated seem easy.

You’ll work with a wide array of technologies (some of which you probably won’t be familiar with when joining). So a desire and ability to learn new tools is essential. You’ll be working directly with the founder & CEO, as well as our Chief Engineer, to develop the tools that will allow the company to grow in the long term.

From the first day, you’ll be given a lot of responsibility, so you must be able to work and get things done independently. Although the core role is development, you shouldn’t be afraid to pitch in where needed (including admin, sales and support).

DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES


You will:


* Work on e-commerce

* Improve our website

* Build integrations with our email provider and CRM

* Track analytics

* Put in place unit tests and quality control mechanisms to improve our codebase.

* Perform server maintenance tasks in Microsoft Azure




SKILLS AND REQUIREMENTS


Candidates must have 7+ years of experience in commercial programming roles. In addition, candidates should have extensive knowledge of the following languages and technologies:


* Languages: ASP.NET MVC, Microsoft C#, JavaScript

* Development Environments: Visual Studio




Candidates should have experience in:


* E-commerce (we use TeaCommerce with Stripe and Paypal)

* Working with source control

* Unit testing




Candidates will have an advantage if they have experience of, or ability to learn, the following:


* Content management systems (we use Umbraco)

* Email service providers (we use Campaign Monitor)

* Customer relationship management (we use Close)

* AngularJS

* Identity Server

* SQL Server

* Azure




OTHER DETAILS


Contract type: Permanent (subject to a six-month trial).

Salary: £40k - £45k.

Remote working: 100% Work from home.

BEFORE YOU CONTACT US

Candidates must have the right to work in the UK, and must be based in the UK.

We do not work with recruiters.

As Intelligent Editing’s employee number five, you’ll have a wide set of responsibilities and the opportunity to contribute across as much of the business as interests you. You’ll take charge of our e-commerce, website, web applications, web integrations, and analytics. Our audience are (mostly) not technologists, so you’ll make the complicated seem easy.

You’ll work with a wide array of technologies (some of which you probably won’t be familiar with when joining). So a desire and ability to learn new tools is essential. You’ll be working directly with the founder & CEO, as well as our Chief Engineer, to develop the tools that will allow the company to grow in the long term.

From the first day, you’ll be given a lot of responsibility, so you must be able to work and get things done independently. Although the core role is development, you shouldn’t be afraid to pitch in where needed (including admin, sales and support).

DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES

You will:

  • Work on e-commerce
  • Improve our website
  • Build integrations with our email provider and CRM
  • Track analytics
  • Put in place unit tests and quality control mechanisms to improve our codebase.
  • Perform server maintenance tasks in Microsoft Azure

SKILLS AND REQUIREMENTS

Candidates must have 7+ years of experience in commercial programming roles. In addition, candidates should have extensive knowledge of the following languages and technologies:

  • Languages: ASP.NET MVC, Microsoft C#, JavaScript
  • Development Environments: Visual Studio

Candidates should have experience in:

  • E-commerce (we use TeaCommerce with Stripe and Paypal)
  • Working with source control
  • Unit testing

Candidates will have an advantage if they have experience of, or ability to learn, the following:

  • Content management systems (we use Umbraco)
  • Email service providers (we use Campaign Monitor)
  • Customer relationship management (we use Close)
  • AngularJS
  • Identity Server
  • SQL Server
  • Azure

OTHER DETAILS

Contract type: Permanent (subject to a six-month trial).

Salary: £40k - £45k.

Remote working: 100% Work from home.

BEFORE YOU CONTACT US

Candidates must have the right to work in the UK, and must be based in the UK.

We do not work with recruiters.

Apply now

About Intelligent Editing Ltd

Intelligent Editing launched in 2009. We’re not going to be the next Uber, and we don’t want to be. We like being small and profitable with a great team. We believe in steady growth, quality service and producing an excellent product.

We produce software that works with English-language documents. Our flagship software, PerfectIt, is an add-in for MS Word that finds mistakes that spelling and grammar checkers won’t find, such as consistency errors and style issues. The English language is a beast! And working to automate proofreading tasks for English is one of the most challenging and interesting aspects of our work.

We’re at the forefront of proofreading/editing technologies. We were among the first companies to produce apps for Office and add-ons for Google Docs, and we have plans to do more development in these environments as the next generation of word processors takes off.

BENEFITS

Work from Home

Candidates should be based in the United Kingdom. Intelligent Editing has no offices, so candidates should be equipped to work from home.

Flexible Working

We have a team call every day between 3pm and 5pm (UK time). All other hours are flexible. If you produce great work, we don’t care when you do it.

A Life Beyond Programming

We believe that it’s impossible for developers to work more than forty hours per week and sustain quality. Our founder is a workaholic, but he doesn’t want others doing that! So we work forty hours per week, and we don’t usually do overtime.

We’re sympathetic to the demands of parenting and welcome applications from experienced professionals who need the flexibility that life with children demands.

A Stake in Success

We offer equity in the business so you will own your success. Equity options will be negotiated at the end of the first year.

Find out more about us at www.intelligentediting.com

Benefits

  • Work from home
  • Have an equity stake in a startup's success
  • Flexible hours
  • Small team that listens to you
  • A life beyond programming

Employees are treated so well that they had four employees retire this year with over fifty years of service. The culture has a family feel and employees can move to other departments. The Information Technology department is a collaborative work environment. This position is open due to growth.

?

The SAP and .NET Software Programmer is responsible for designing and writing SAP software within project timelines. This position will report to the Application Development Manager. The successful candidate will learn .net if they are lacking that experience. The department will be going through a conversion from SAP ECC 6.0 to SAP S/4HANA so the employees will gain that experience as well.?? The culture is important here so establishing and maintaining effective working relationships with?? others is important. This person will be responsible for maintaining confidentiality.The company is located in north central Wisconsin but welcomes employees to work remotely.

?

Candidates will have a minimum background consisting of the following:
  • Ability to go to central Wisconsin every other week for the first six months and quarterly thereafter?? 4 years of software applications development experience
  • 4 years of experience developing ABAP 2 years of .net programming experience
  • Knowledge of FI, CO, MM, PP, SD functional areas in SAP A degree
  • Solid organizational skills
  • Ability to be organized to meet timelines
?

S/4HANA experience is preferred but not required.

items.title: Software Developer Remote - £30,000 - £38,000
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=42, c=4, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
Software Developer - Remote working - (£30,000 - £35,000)

The organisation in question are based in Manchester and they are keen to recruit experienced Software Developers, ideally with suitable amount of experience working with C# .NET, mid level developers with 3+ years experience considered.

This role is fully remote, with travel to London 2 days every other week (all expenses paid). Ideally commutable to Manchester, however candidates from further afield are certainly welcome to be considered.

Although this role is 'full stack' they are keen to speak to applicants with a strong background working with Microsoft .NET technologies. You'll be working on cutting edge projects, primarily enterprise in scale. As a Software Developer, you'll be expected to work across the full Software Development Lifecycle. You'll also be given a voice, encouraged to research and suggest new technologies if you feel they'd be more suitable for the respective solution.

As an organisation, they are extremely keen to be a company that keeps up to date and manage to aid the whole development process. Using tools such as Visual Studio subscription, Management Studio 2017, ReSharper, Azure DevOps etc help to do so.

In terms of the specific candidate requirements, rather than simply regurgitating the job description, I wanted to highlight a few key areas below:

Tech Stack - Microsoft .NET C# is essential, but any experience with wider languages/frameworks such as Azure is also beneficial. They are a 'true tech company' and like to hire people who aren't just confined/limited to a single technology area.

Development - due to the nature of the organisation (e.g. Consultancy), a passion for all things web and the drive to build something big from the ground up. The Ideal candidate will have the ability to create high quality, usable and scalable web applications from day one.

In return, you will benefit from an above market-rate salary (£30,000 - £35,000), varied benefits package and the opportunity to work with cutting edge technologies in a forward thinking company. Moreover, you will be given a tailored 'T-shaped' progression route, with opportunities to move into the Senior Developer, Technical Lead roles later on down the line.

If you are keen to learn a bit more about this specific opportunity then I would be happy to set up a follow up chat - I can be contacted by the following means:

Office Line:

Email:

items.content:
.Net Developer (Remote)

Primary Location Des Moines, Iowa

V-Soft Consulting is currently hiring for a .Net Developer (Remote)for our premier client in Des Moines, Iowa. This is a full time, direct hire position in the real estate industry.

WHAT YOU LL NEED:

Education and Experience

  • High School diploma or equivalent required
  • Bachelor s Degree preferred, preferably in Information Technology, Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or Software Engineering
  • 3+ years experience in a role related to application development with a heavy focus on software development and systems design
  • 3+ years experience with a variety of server-side and client-side programming languages; experience developing applications in Microsoft Visual Studio preferred
  • Hands-on experience within a Microsoft development environment, particularly utilizing .NET and SQL platforms

Knowledge, Skills and Abilities

  • Ability to comprehend business needs and to translate said needs into technical specifications
  • Demonstrated ability to apply Project Management principles
  • Functional knowledge of Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC) methodologies
  • Strong familiarity with web-based MVC application development principals
  • Strong customer service orientation with the ability to effectively communicate with both technical and non-technical stakeholders

WHAT YOU LL DO:

Job Responsibilities

  • Prepare code to enable the development and/or modification of Applications based on customer/business needs
  • Establish and maintain effective relationships with all stakeholders
  • Identify, recommend, and implement solutions to complex problems as directed by Development Leadership
  • Complete testing and gather feedback to improve the quality and reduce operational risk of the developed Application
  • Undertake post-release activities to develop a base of knowledge to be incorporated in future build and release cycles
  • Review and modify existing Applications to correct errors, adapt to new software versions, or to upgrade interfaces and improve performance
  • Gather requirements, create design documentation and perform impact analysis for Application changes for various projects
  • Provide proper documentation of Applications per Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC) and PMM Requirements
  • Collaborate with database administrators to design, develop and update databases as they relate to software programs and applications
  • Diagnoses and troubleshoots problems within existing systems and applications
  • Provide project leadership in the scoping, design and execution of systems for automation, compliance, and efficiency improvements to business functions

Interested?

Qualified candidates should send their resumes to

V-Soft Consulting is a trusted partner with experience across diverse technology stacks to help business get IT done. What makes V-Soft different? Our expertise is derived from over 20 years of delivering world-class IT staffing, consulting, engineering and managed services to Fortune 1000 and mid-market companies in the U.S., Canada, and Asia.

V-Soft is headquartered in Louisville, KY with strategic locations in India, Canada, and across the U.S., including Madison, Chicago, Denver, Harrisburg and Atlanta. V-Soft has been recognized among the top 100 fastest growing staffing companies in North America and is known for the ability to provide highly qualified consultants for any project at any scale. V-Soft has a wide variety of partnerships across diverse technology stacks, and holds such titles as MuleSoft Certified Delivery Resource, Oracle Gold Partner, ServiceNow Partner, Microsoft Partner, and Cisco Registered Partner, amongst many others.

Like what you hear? Apply with V-Soft today!

For more information or to view all our open jobs, please visit or call .

- provided by Dice

They are seeking a Python Developer for their growing operations team. Initially this role will be focused on automating their existing data feeds. When this task is complete, the role will move to focus on various machine learning and artificial intelligence initiatives to deliver on their significant product expansion plans.

Job Duties;

  • Automate ETL processes to make it a 'low touch, no touch' import process
  • Understand and execute existing ETL processes for respondent surveys
  • Convert, parse and manipulate respondent level data files using proprietary utilities
  • Prepare hierarchical Codebook files, text editing
  • Monitor and resolve data irregularities
  • Validate data to adhere to established quality standards
  • Liaise with data suppliers

Required Skills & Experience;

  • Python Development
  • Experience working in a data-processing or statistical environment
  • Working knowledge of SQL
  • Proficiency with ETL

Desirable (Nice-to-Have) Skills & Experience;

  • Bachelor's Degree or equivalent in a technical (e.g. mathematical/scientific/statistical/software) subject
  • Experience with text-editing software, e.g. UltraEdit, TextPad, Notepad++
  • Experience with SPSS statistical package and scripting languages
  • Experience of Agile Scrum or Lean Kanban Development
  • Visual Studio .Net (C#, C++, VB.Net), R
  • AWS EC2 and S3
  • Big Data analysis Spark/Hadoop
  • Understanding of Machine Learning and AI techniques

Other Stuff;

  • £'s; fully DoE up to approx. £40k (neg.),
  • Benefits; Holiday 20 days, Gym Membership Contribution, Season Ticket Loan,
  • Location; Either based from their London office (Baker Street), or remotely from your home (if you are suitable but based outside London),

Note: This is a 100% Remote Opportunity.

Job Description:

Technical Skills / Knowledge Required:

  • A minimum of Eight (8) years Software Development in a Product based organization.
  • Experience working in a collaborative team environment.
  • Experience with Object Oriented Programming.
  • Experience with Database Design and Implementation.
  • Understanding of n-tier Application Architecture (e.g. MVC, SOA) and Design Patterns.
  • .NET certification preferred.
  • Experience designing and implementing .Net solutions with a focus on SOA, messaging, and business rules
  • Working knowledge of web services, service discovery protocol, messaging protocols (REST, RPC, WS-*, SOAP etc.), and schema design.
  • Strong interpersonal, communication, and writing skills
  • Experience developing solutions integrating and extending COTS products
  • Experience with performance tuning and optimization of service-based Framework infrastructure and services
  • Experience working with State government clients in the Medicaid systems domain preferred.

Technologies Used:

  • C#, ASP.NET
  • Windows Communication Foundation (WCF) - Web Services and Windows Services
  • SQL Server 2012
  • T-SQL Programming (e.g. stored procedures, views, functions, triggers)
  • HTML/XHTML , XML/XSLT, AJAX, SOAP
  • SQL Reporting Services
  • JavaScript, jQuery
  • CSS
  • Cross-browser compliance

Personal/Soft Skills:

Excellent organizational, interpersonal, verbal, and written communication skills, strong analysis, problem identification, and problem resolution capability, ability to perform comfortably in a fast-paced, deadline oriented work environment, ability to successfully manage many complex tasks simultaneously, ability to lead a cooperative effort among members of a project team and ability to mentor new project staff.

Duties/Responsibilities:

  • Maintain and modify existing software programs and perform software design and development, unit testing, and debugging of software code.
  • Design, develop and test software components, and document and diagram application functionality from business requirements.
  • Participate in design and code reviews.
  • Develop custom adapters allowing the integration of legacy (i.e., capabilities not developed as services) capabilities with service-based Framework infrastructure and services
  • Primary point of contact for assigned technical deliverables.
  • Ensure development activities are aligned with scope, schedule, priority and business objectives.
  • Meet or exceed all operational readiness requirements (e.g., operations engineering, performance).
  • Ensure all tasks and milestones associated with technical design, development and unit testing are completed according to project management guidelines.
  • Ensures that product configurations and enhancements are made correctly and deployed per our release management plan.
  • Responsible for the development and finalization of all technical system documentation.
  • Support MAXIMUS business development activities by providing technical solutions and system architecture documentation for proposal development.
  • Deploy new software releases to higher environments.

Education Required:

  • Bachelor s Degree in Computer Science from an accredited college or university or equivalent experience
  • Education Preferred: Master s Degree

Thank you for your time and consideration

Regards,

Praveen Vaante

CompuGain

12901 Worldgate Drive, Suite 510

Herndon, Virginia 20170

items.content:
TYPO3 Web-Developer (m/w/d)

About this job

Job type: Full-time
Experience level: Junior, Mid-Level, Senior
Role: Backend Developer
Industry: Mobile Application, Web Design, Web Development
Company size: 11–50 people
Company type: Private
Company: sgalinski | No office location

Remote details

Preferred Timezone: (GMT+01:00) Berlin +/- 2 hours

Technologies

php
typo3
typoscript
fluid
mysql

Job description

Du suchst eine (neue) Betätigung im TYPO3-Bereich als Web-Developer? Dann haben wir bei sgalinski Internet Services das neue passende Umfeld für dich!

Die Position versetzt dich in die Lage direkt die Wünsche des Kunden im TYPO3 CMS zu überführen und gegebenenfalls fehlende Features als Erweiterung selbst zu implementieren.

Um diese Aufgabe bewältigen zu können, solltest du folgende Eigenschaften mitbringen:

  • Solide Kenntnisse im Umgang mit PHP
  • Erfahrung in der Integration von TYPO3 CMS-Websites und/oder -Portalen
  • Interesse am Lernen von neuen Technologien
  • Offenheit gegenüber OpenSource ist ein Muss
  • Gute Englisch-Kenntnisse in Wort und Schrift sind notwendig (!)
  • Du bist kein Eigenbrötler und arbeitest gerne in einem Team
  • Wertschätzung von Qualität (!)
  • Selbstständige Arbeitsweise in einem agilen Unternehmen

Eventuell hast du auch schon Erfahrung mit dem Shopware eCommerce-System gesammelt. Dies ist jedoch keine zwingende Voraussetzung!

Da sgalinski vollständig remote organisiert ist, genießen unsere Mitarbeiter eine gute Work-Life-Balance und große Familienfreundlichkeit.

Zur Übersicht: Jobs und Leistungen

Apply now

About sgalinski

Wir sind eine Webagentur aus München, die sich speziell auf TYPO3 fokussiert hat. Ebenso bieten wir aber auch andere Leistungen und Produkte an wie Shops, Mobile Apps und spezielle Software-Entwicklung.

Wir sind ein eingespieltes Team, welches dank agiler Arbeitsweise und regem Kundenkontakt digitale Projekte mit hohem Qualitätsstandard abschließt. Grundsätzlich arbeiten wir remote, sind auf mehrere europäische Länder verteilt und verwenden gerne Englisch als interne Sprache. Somit hast du die Möglichkeit in einem aufstrebenden, multinationalen Unternehmen zu arbeiten und dich zu profilieren.

Benefits

  • Flexible Arbeitszeiten
  • Home Office
  • Familienfreundlichkeit
  • Vollzeit oder Teilzeit - je nach Bedarf
  • Wir verwenden kein Windows in der Firma! MacOS & Linux sind erwünscht.
  • Leistungsorientierte Bezahlung mit solidem Grundgehalt
  • Optionale betriebliche Altersvorsorge
  • Flache Strukturen
  • Recht auf Mitsprache
  • Möglichkeit sich in Open-Source-Projekten zu engagieren

  • Interesse am Lernen von neuen Technologien
  • Offenheit gegenüber OpenSource ist ein Muss
  • Gute Englisch-Kenntnisse in Wort und Schrift sind notwendig (!)
  • Du bist kein Eigenbrötler und arbeitest gerne in einem Team
  • Wertschätzung von Qualität (!)
  • Selbstständige Arbeitsweise in einem agilen Unternehmen

Erfahrung in der Integration von TYPO3 CMS-Websites und/oder -Portalen ist von Vorteil, aber nicht zwingend nötig.

Eventuell hast Du auch schon Erfahrung mit dem Shopware eCommerce-System gesammelt. Dies ist jedoch keine zwingende Voraussetzung!

Da sgalinski vollständig remote organisiert ist, genießen unsere Mitarbeiter eine gute Work-Life-Balance und große Familienfreundlichkeit.

Zur Übersicht: Jobs und Leistungen

Apply now

About sgalinski

Wir sind eine Webagentur aus München, die sich speziell auf TYPO3 fokussiert hat. Ebenso bieten wir aber auch andere Leistungen und Produkte an wie Shops, Mobile Apps und spezielle Software-Entwicklung.

Wir sind ein eingespieltes Team, welches dank agiler Arbeitsweise und regem Kundenkontakt digitale Projekte mit hohem Qualitätsstandard abschließt. Grundsätzlich arbeiten wir remote, sind auf mehrere europäische Länder verteilt und verwenden gerne Englisch als interne Sprache. Somit hast du die Möglichkeit in einem aufstrebenden, multinationalen Unternehmen zu arbeiten und dich zu profilieren.

Benefits

  • Flexible Arbeitszeiten
  • Home Office
  • Familienfreundlichkeit
  • Vollzeit oder Teilzeit - je nach Bedarf
  • Wir verwenden kein Windows in der Firma! MacOS & Linux sind erwünscht.
  • Leistungsorientierte Bezahlung mit solidem Grundgehalt
  • Optionale betriebliche Altersvorsorge
  • Flache Strukturen
  • Recht auf Mitsprache
  • Möglichkeit sich in Open-Source-Projekten zu engagieren

items.content:
.NET Developer - remote working

Exciting opportunity on behalf of an established client with the UK office based in central London.

Do you wish to work from home with an office visit once a fortnight. We are looking for an experienced .NET developer to join an Integrations team based in the UK.

This role will be permanently remote, but there will be a requirement to spend a day in the London office every two weeks, so we're looking for people who are based within a reasonable travel time of central London (less than 2 hours). Candidates based outside this travel radius are unlikely to be considered.

The profile of the person we're looking for is what I would describe as 'middleweight to senior'. The ideal candidate would have:

  • Excellent .NET development skills with C#
  • Good experience of developing .NET Web applications (Web Forms / MVC / Web API)
  • Other .NET development experience (services, libraries, SOAP & REST API's, ETL, SSIS)
  • Strong relational database experience with MSSQL
  • Disciplined and self-motivating approach to work - they need to take full ownership of tasks assigned

Our client is looking for someone that is more into back end development, systems integration, etc.

The purpose of this role is to build, maintain and support tools, libraries and other code that integrates customer back-office systems.

Any relevant domain experience in advertising, and in particular any experience with other industry toolsets such as Google ad technologies, would be a distinct advantage but is not a requirement.

Excellent benefits and company bonus scheme.

Full Stack Javascript Developer - Systems Development, Google Polymer, Angular, React - REMOTE WORKING

Full stack Javascript Development, experienced, Google Polymer, Angualr / React.

Full stack C# .NET and web-based developer This role reports to the Development Manager and will require travelling to their office in Hertfordshire for the initial training period. Thereafter this is a home working position with ad-hoc requirement to travel to office.

Job Description

The role is primarily a systems developer and is mainly concerned with providing a web-based framework which allows other developers to create line-of-business applications. You will predominantly work with the development manager to extend and enhance the framework to meet new requirements and new industry standards in a constantly evolving process with high demands from across the group. In particular, you will focus on UX and providing a set of tools which allow the creation of engaging and modern applications across all device types. In this role, you will find a certain degree of creative freedom to create new systems.

Skills required

A great enthusiasm for creating quality software in particular creating systems which are elegant, extendable, and sustainable over the long-term

Long-term experience of C# .NET and ASP.NET.

Long-term experience of browser-based technologies, with a deep understanding of javascript.

Some experience of Google Polymer is essential

Demonstrable experience of working with modern web-based frameworks and toolchains

Experience of relational databases, in particular, Microsoft SQL Server

A strong ability to work on own initiative and achieve timely results

Experience of Isomorphic Smartclient is desirable but not essential

items.content:
Job Description

The ideal candidate is a self-motivated, multi-tasker, and demonstrated team-player. You will be a lead developer responsible for the development of new software products and enhancements to existing products. You should excel in working with large-scale applications and frameworks and have outstanding communication and leadership skills.

Responsibilities

  • Writing clean, high-quality, high-performance, maintainable code
  • Develop and support software including applications, database integration, interfaces, and new functionality enhancements
  • Coordinate cross-functionally to insure project meets business objectives and compliance standards
  • Support test and deployment of new products and features
  • Participate in code reviews

QualificationsComputer Science Degree (or equivalent) We are currently building the core of our engineering team, so applicants will need to have a deep understanding of computer science principals that can be applied to building the foundations of our technology (adegree in computer science is preferred, but some education is acceptable if you can proveyou know your stuff!).

Experience creating Xamarin Forms mobile apps targeting iOS and Android (or equivalent

.NET/XAML experience plus some native mobile experience). Experience building secure

and scalable .NET/.NET Core web apps and API s.

  • Bachelor's degree in Computer Science (or related field)
  • 8+ years of relevant work experience
  • Experience with Agile or Scrum software development methodologies
  • Ability to multi-task, organize, and prioritize work

Company Description

Who We Are
RexPay is a healthcare technology startup based in Phoenix, Arizona. We're on a mission to
rescue patients from medical bill mayhem by helping them manage their medical bills and
payments all in one place. Being sick is a pain. Medical bills shouldn't be.

Associated topics: application developer, backend, back end, design pattern, develop, devops, maven, php, senior software developer, senior software engineer

tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=40, c=2, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=2, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=13}
items.content:
Prime Insurance

Mid Senior Microsoft Developer With Team Experience


Prime Insurance Company is seeking a motivated software developer who works well with a distributed team, and wants to help establish a remote first culture. 

We are a Microsoft shop. Our data lives on Sql Server, and a mix of Access and .Net MVC/AngularJS front ends. We source control everything in git (including Access!), build on Team City, and deploy with Octopus.

You must be located in the United States, and authorized to work here. We are unable to sponsor H1-B Visa's at this time.

We expect remote employees to overlap at least 6 hours with the Sandy, Utah office (we're there 8am-5pm Mountain time).

Responsibilities


* Develop new features using the Microsoft stack (C# / Sql Server / JavaScript) to support new business growth

* Test and debug existing systems 

* Assist in identifying and implementing new ways to improve the quality and experience of our systems

* Contribute to success through software craftsmanship principles




What we look for in our team members


* Passion for new technology

* Team player mentality

* Quality focus on doing it right the first time

* Strong communication skills




Remote Candidates


* Verifiable experience with a remote development team.




Required Experience


* 6+ years progressive experience developing software

* Expertise in Web UI Development including HTML, CSS, Razor and Javascript

* Strong working knowledge of Microsoft SQL Server, including SSRS and SSIS

* .Net Framework 4.0 through .Net 4.7.2

* Good understanding of JSON and RESTful services, experience with microservices a plus

* Good understanding Unit Testing tools such as NUnit

* Strong working knowledge of source control systems including git

* Knowledge of best practices for the full software development life cycle, including coding standards, code reviews, source control management, build processes, testing and operations




Bonus points for


* Insurance industry experience

* Microsoft Access / VBA development experience

* RedGate Sql Change Control

items.content:
TRIRIGA Application DeveloperThe TRIRIGA Application Developer role requires active engagement in TRIRIGA application development practices, research, and development of leading solutions for internal and external customers. The incumbent will liaison with Architecture, Information Security, Infrastructure and Database Administrators to understand the dependences and policies for data movement across the organization.

Essential Functions
BI Solutions Development and Testing
  • Perform installation, configuration and troubleshooting of off-the-shelf and custom software applications in JLL staging as well as customer test and production?environments.
  • Customize and enhance business software applications including GUI?development/customization, report development, script?development.
  • Contribute to the complete software development life cycle: defining, designing, building, testing, and deploying.
  • Assist with unit testing and quality assurance of the solution build at the various?stages.?
  • Identify gaps and improvements in the proposed design and partner with Solution Consultants and Project Managers to reevaluate the design and project plan.?
Customer Support
  • Analyze customer?s challenges and take a primary role in the design, development and implementation of comprehensive solutions that integrate smoothly into customer?environments.
  • Troubleshoot?first and intermediate level support tickets.
  • Identify gaps and improvements in the proposed design and partner with Solution Consultants and Project Managers to reevaluate the design and project plan.?
Database and Report Development
  • Perform data management tasks and data structure modification, as well as development of data migration interfaces to integrate disparate?applications/databases.
  • Perform data mapping, data manipulation and data migration among various database systems and enterprise applications.
  • Develop BI solutions using Tableau, Power BI, QLIK, or other platforms
  • Develop reports using SQL Server Reporting Services, Microsoft Access or other reporting?tools.?
Education, Certifications and Experience
Required
  • Undergraduate degree or comparable work experience in relevant domain.
  • 2 ? 7 years of relevant work?experience.?
Preferred
  • 3years of relevant work experience.
  • Relevant technical and/or IWMS?certifications.
  • Tableau certification (server or?desktop).?
Knowledge, Skills and Abilities
Required
  • Working knowledge of relational database?systems,?object-oriented?programming,?andweb application development.
  • Solid understanding of?development and programming?best?practices.
  • Experience with various web API's.
  • Implementation and deployment experience with enterprise software.
  • Ability to translate standard requirements into technical tasks.
  • Effective written and verbal communication skills.
  • Ability to convey thoughts and ideas in a clear and concise?manner.?
  • Experience with Crystal Reports, Business Objects or similar reporting software.
  • Experience working with Tableau (desktop and server), QLIK, Power BI, or similar tools.
  • Working experience with multiple programming languages such as Fusion, ASP, ASP.NET, JAVA, AXVW, JavaScript, XML, HTML, PL/T-SQL, etc.
  • Ability to adhere to project schedules, project constraints and the prioritization of project?tasks.???
Preferred
  • Implementation, deployment or working experience with ARCHIBUS, IBM TRIRIGA, Manhattan or other Integrated Workplace Management System?(IWMS).?
  • Experience with both the Oracle and the MSSQL platforms: proficiency in administering, designing, building, and troubleshooting queries, procedures, and functions.
  • Experience in development of dashboards in Tableau.
  • Understanding application security and server?configuration.
  • Experience working with ETL processes & systems, and data management practices.
  • Working knowledge of data modeling and governance practices.
#LI

JLL Privacy Notice
Jones Lang LaSalle (JLL), together with its subsidiaries and affiliates, is a leading global provider of real estate and investment management services. We take our responsibility to protect the personal information provided to us seriously. Generally the personal information we collect from you are for the purposes of processing in connection with JLL?s recruitment process. We endeavour to keep your personal information secure with appropriate level of security and keep for as long as we need it for legitimate business or legal reasons. We will then delete it safely and securely.

For more information about how JLL processes your personal data, please view our Candidate Privacy Statement .

For additional details please see our career site pages for each country.

For employees in the United States, please see a fully copy of our Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action policy here .

Jones Lang LaSalle (?JLL?) is an Equal Opportunity Employer and is committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodations to individuals with disabilities.? If you need a reasonable accommodation because of a disability for any part of the employment process ? including the online application and/or overall selection process ?? you may email us at [Click Here to Email Your Resum?] . This email is only to request an accommodation. Please direct any other general recruiting inquiries to our Contact Us page > I want to work for JLL.

items.content:
Senior Software Developer

United Kingdom, Yorkshire
Company: FMG

Overview

Senior Software Developer

Based in Huddersfield

Salary of up to £55,000 depending on experience

Do you have a strong background in Software Development?

Do you want to take a positive step in your career, where you will be responsible for the development, maintenance and support of a number of bespoke software applications?

Do you want to work for a growing company, who will provide a supportive and flexible working environment?

If so, we have a fantasitc opportunity for a Senior Developer within our Software Development team here at FMG, we are the UK’s leading independant provider of fleet incident management and specialist vehicle recovery services.

The Role:

As a Software Developer within FMG you will be responsible for the development, maintenance, support and documentation of a number of software applications that are critical to the continued operation of the business.

You will work closely with the Business Transformation team and provide expert advice regarding the application of software development based on business requirements.

It is important that you keep pace with technology changes as you will be proactive in identifying new technologies that will enhance and excel proposed and existing IT platforms.

Who we’re looking for:

You will have over 2 years’ experience in Programming and Software Development using the relevant tools and technologies, with the ability to deal with Trouble Shooting and Problem Solving.

You should have abilities in the following – understanding relational database and technologies, understanding and application of client/server architecture and a solid understanding of Unit Testing.

Technical Competencies required – Microsoft Technology Stack, C#, .Net Framework, ASP.net, MVC and a working knowledge of HTML, Angular or other equivalent frameworks, JavaScript and CSS

In return you can expect:

  • A competitive salary, aligned to your level of experience

  • The ability to work remotely on a weekly basis (once established in the role)

  • 25 days holiday increasing to 28 with length of service

  • Contributory pension scheme

  • Life assurance

  • Free car parking / shuttle bus for staff travelling on public transport

  • New offices with fantastic modern break out areas, onsite canteen, kitchen facilities, TV area, and shower facilities for those that want to take advantage of the cycle to work scheme.

  • Free eye tests and a variety of discounts with local businesses

Apply for job

items.content:
Minimum Required Skills:
C#, Python, Java, Mendix, SQL Server, MySQL

If you are a Senior Software Developer with experience, please read on!

This is a 100% remote position that requires experience with Mendix.

Top Reasons to Work with Us

As a Senior Software Engineer you will be an integral part of our engineering team, serving as a key contributor to solution design, development and release. You will be working with key stakeholders from the product and business teams as well as other software developers to ensure proper delivery. The software engineer contributes to system design, database design, and feature execution while adhering to coding standards and participating in code reviews.

You understand software design, standard coding principles, database operations and code optimization. In addition, you understand the Mendix platform; specifically how to apply domain models, UI models and microflows to deliver scalable solutions.

In this role you will focus on delivering products and solutions that directly impact internal and external user?s day-to-day productivity. You must be able to balance the desire system elegance against the new for rapid delivery.

What You Will Be Doing

Your focus will be:
Software design, prototyping and development
Following standard coding practices
Work on assignments as directed
Coordinate works across the team

Major responsibilities of this role include:
Establish and maintain coding standard and practices
Participate in software design decisions
Coordinate work on individual sprints
Work with the development team, scrum master and product owners
Collaborate with team members on coding decisions

What You Need for this Position

Education:

items.content:
AWS Lambda Developer

About this job

Job type: Full-time
Experience level: Senior
Role: Full Stack Developer
Company: Genius Central | No office location

Remote details

Preferred Timezone: (GMT-05:00) Eastern Time

Technologies

aws-lambda
api-gateway
amazon-cognito
rest
c#

Job description

Do you wake up excited to work on APIs in AWS?  If so, you will focus on building out our RESTful APIs using API Gateway, Lambda, Cognito, DynamoDB.  These APIs serve our customers, our applications and our internal users.  Currently most of our APIs are written using C# / .Net Core, you will help shape our future API landscape and accelerated API development using AWS technologies.  

You must be a strong AWS developer, confident in code quality, advocate for best practices and patterns, think security first and be comfortable working in an agile team using continuous delivery. 

Essential Skills and Responsibilities:

  • Strong AWS Developer using API Gateway, Lambda, DynamoDB, RDS, CloudWatch, CloudFormation
  • Write unit and integration tests for API endpoints
  • Pay careful attention to authorization and authentication concerns as they relate to APIs
  • You insist on a robust delivery pipeline (AWS Build Tools)
  • Participate in Sprint Planning, Retrospective and Daily Stand Up meetings
  • Do what it takes to help the development team complete the sprint
  • Critical thinking and problem solving
  • Good written and verbal communication skills

You will be a great fit if:

  • You insist on best patterns and practices, code consistency
  • You believe in small batch development and deployment
  • You understand common strategies for code reuse across multiple APIs
  • You understand strategies for safely, continuously deploying code
  • You love to learn, and you learn fast
  • You like working on a team collaboratively to solve complex problems
  • You have a growth mindset
  • You are a fan of pair programming and sharing your work
  • You actively seek out help when you are stuck
  • You are willing to have your point of view challenged, and to respectfully challenge other points of view
  • You are willing to be held accountable and to hold others accountable
  • You like having your work peer reviewed, and peer reviewing other team members work
  • Finishing quality work on time brings you immense pleasure
  • You are able to jump in to our C# / .Net Core API layer if necessary

Recommended Skills (not essential):

  • Implementation of REST API endpoints using C# / Web API / .Net Core / Entity Framework
  • SQS, SNS, S3
Apply now

About Genius Central

We are a small technology company that operates primarily within the Natural Products Industry.  Our mission is to provide effective, high quality, affordable supply chain technology and services to retailers and their vendors.  We are seeking applicants with a continuous improvement mindset, and the right mix of cultural fit and technology experience, to join our Development team. 

If this feels like a good fit for you, we would love to hear from you!

items.title: Software Engineer Principal
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=92, c=4, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=27, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=45}
items.content:
Software Engineer Principal

United States, Colorado
Company: WOW! Internet Phone Cable

Overview

You will provide architecture, design, development and test support for new software projects as well as responsibility for general maintenance and troubleshooting activities for solutions implemented in the production environment. The position will play a leadership role in helping embrace new technologies, and develop new platform built on various technologies including but not limited to a variety of AWS Cloud Services, Node.js, MS.Net, MSSQL, Oracle and other Open Source RDMS such as Postgres, Aurora or MySQL up in the cloud. This role entails working with a dedicated team of developers, along with both internal partners (Scrum masters, Architects, Agile members) and external partners or vendors. You will have hands on involvement in design, development and testing of new software projects in an Agile and DevOps model, as well as responsibility around Continuous Improvements for Application Development production systems and interfaces. You will have strong relational skills and be able to effectively communicate technical and non-technical ideas, written and verbal, to individuals and large groups.

What you’ll do:

  • Help define and articulate the platform architecture required to support business initiatives and product strategy.
  • Help define enterprise wide technology standards to promote creation of flexible customer oriented solutions and help technical teams evolve solutions towards enterprise standards.
  • Evaluate new technologies from simple research through setting up and running an effective proof-of-concept, to determine if and when they should be incorporated into the business.
  • Work with Enterprise Architects in defining the product vision.
  • Establish realistic timeline estimates while ensuring projects remain on target to meet deadlines.
  • Help developers resolve technical problems as well as work with department heads to solve business related issues.
  • Perform standard software development tasks associated with the design and development of new applications or maintenance of existing applications using Microsoft .NET Core, .NET and C# as well as new implementations of AWS Cloud.
  • Perform system database design as well as modifications necessary to correct database defects.
  • Builds automated test (ie. Unit, Integration, Performance, Load, among others) and performs validation of functionality within and between applications.
  • Participate in application documentation (ie. Specifications, Design, Diagrams, Catalog, among others) to easily disseminate knowledge and support purposes.
  • Communicate with department management, Scrum masters, team members and business groups on issues and the status of work planned and completed.
  • Participate in selection of tools, technology platforms & technical evaluation of 3rd party vendor products.
  • Provide recommendations for improving processes and procedures, and may function as an escalation point and/or training resource for the other developers.
  • Ensure applications meet design specifications, adhere to standard coding practices and function per the requirements specification.
  • Provide mentorship to others by reviewing work and providing recommendations for design, coding or testing approach, which could include conducting or participating in code walkthroughs or other methods to ensure code quality.
  • Maintain availability for after-hours production support on an as-needed basis.
  • May manage development resources or act in a team lead capacity and execute on multiple projects simultaneously with distributed teams.

What we’re looking for:

  • Proven leadership and architecture experience building and managing highly available, critical and transactional data environments, systems architectures and technologies.
  • Demonstrable experience building and managing highly available, critical systems and services.
  • 10 years of experience working through design, development, release, support and improvements cycle.
  • Will be comfortable in rapidly changing and sometimes ambiguous work situations. Keen attention to detail and complex problem solving abilities from an operational and technical perspective. Ability to work independently and engage manager as needed.
  • Extraordinary verbal and written communication skills.
  • Firm grasp of application development methodologies and object oriented principles.
  • Will be able to handle changes to requirements through effective application of change control processes and tools.
  • Ability to participate in peer reviews and inspections of requirements documents.
  • Strong leadership, project management, time management and problem solving skills.
  • Ability to work with technical and non-technical business owners to get things done.
  • Strong problem solving and root cause analysis skills.
  • Will have great interpersonal skills.

Education/Experience:

  • Bachelor’s degree in computer science or equivalent certification or experience.
  • 12+ years of application development and integration experience using .NET technologies (Rest API, WCF, Web Services, C#.NET, ASP.NET).
  • 8+ years of experience in web based front end development (JavaScript — Node.js, Angular, React, JQuery, HTML5, Bootstrap/CSS)
  • Experience with Microsoft .NET Framework (4.x), .NET Core and Visual Studio 2015.
  • Proficiency with Unit Testing, Test Driven Development and Continuous Delivery
  • Experience with RDBMS like SQL Server, Oracle, Postgres.
  • Experience with Cloud Solutions and Services Development (Preferred AWS)
  • HSD/Telecom/Cable industry knowledge a plus.
  • some travel may be required

Benefits

  • We provide health benefits, 401K, tuition reimbursement, paid vacation and much more.
  • We provide ample opportunity for growth within the organization.

We would love for you to apply if you’re a believer in our Core Values: Respect, Integrity, Spirit of Service and Accountability. What are you waiting for? You can apply today and we can begin our journey together.
Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions and physical demands of the job.
WOW is an Equal Opportunity Employer/Minorities/Women/Protected Veterans/Disabled/Sexual Orientation/Religion/Gender Identity employer

Apply for job

items.content:
Looking for a Sr. IT Architect to provide technical leadership and develop strategic and tactical plans to execute on business strategies and achieve desired outcomes. This position has the ability to work remote / telecommute for the right candidate.

Must have technologies include Java, .NET, C#.

Experience with legacy system modernization, leading transformative initiatives (agile, lean, modernizations)

Nice to have Technologies: AS400 / Mainframe (nice to have), SnapLogic, UiPath, ServiceNow.

This position provides architecture support for one large project or a few small to mid-sized projects.

Responsibilities to include:

- Develop and execute plans to drive lean innovative solutions that promote agility and modernize IT.

- Identify ways to increase employee knowledge and skills to support future growth

- Develop and maintain strong, cooperative relationships with other IT services groups.

- Create architecture models that reflect the strategic goals and objectives.

- Establish development standards and best practices, educate, mentor and coach teams. Establish KPIs to measure and adopt.

- Proven success as a champion of transformation in the area of Continuous Improvement, Agile, and Lean development practices.

- Influence changes and system enhancements to business processes, policies, and infrastructure to deliver the most effective IT services.

- Manage the selection, evaluation, contracting and integration of externally available hardware, software, and processes to deliver business solutions.

Essential Functions:

- Work independently as an architect on a small to mid-sized project.

- Develop application designs that meet the functional requirements of the solution.

- Work together with architects from other domains (application, infrastructure, security, database) to design a solution that meets the non-functional requirements of the solution, this includes Security, Scalability, Performance, Availability and Resiliency of the solution.

- Mindful of the Healthcare Industry and Digital Health trends. "

The salary is £45-50,000 p.a. depending on experience plus an excellent personal development budget that will include Pluralsight and other training plans upon request. The company also offers flexible working hours and scope for some remote working after a probationary period.

If you are interested in the Senior Software Developer role, or would like more information, please submit a copy of your CV or contact Michelle Turner at Bond Williams Professional Recruitment in Bournemouth.

Keywords: Senior Software Developer, Software Engineer, Software Developer, C# Developer, C#, ASP.NET, Web Forms, MVC, .Net Core, Javascript, Jquery, Web Developer.

items.title: Sr. Cloud Application Developer-Remote
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=57, c=0, mobile=2, go=0, nodejs=2, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=36, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=34}
items.content:
RESPONSIBILITIES:
Kforce has a client in Phoenix, Arizona (AZ) that is seeking a Senior Cloud Application Developer for a Remote position.

Summary:
The ideal candidate will work with the platform architecture team members to understand and implement functionality for new solutions. As a Senior Cloud Application Developer working on our platform, you'll be responsible for developing modern, cloud-native, enterprise software that is hosted in the Microsoft Azure cloud environment providing online identity management, transaction processing, and security management in a Software as a Service (SaaS) environment and play an integral role in the success of the product delivery and quality.

Specifically, you are responsible for:
* Analyze problems and implement solutions that trade off architectural constraints of functionality, usability, performance, reliability, cost, and scalability
* Design and implement modern single page application (SPA) web-based user interfaces using best practices such as responsive design to support new functionality
* Write and modify REST APIs using modern application development frameworks like Spring, Micronaut, and .NET Core
* Design and implement new databases and use other forms of storage to persist application data
* Leverage messaging technologies to build loosely-coupled message-based systems
* Deliver application enhancements as part of a continuous delivery methodology
* Program and execute unit test cases using test driven development practices
* Support the full life cycle of the application development including requirements gathering, design, functional and non-functional testing, release, and operations
* Develop technical documentation to facilitate hand-off of the product to an operations team
* Comply with and contribute to consistent development guidelines (coding, change control, build, versioning)

REQUIREMENTS:
* 5+ years of experience in software development using Java or .NET
* 5+ years of experience with SQL Server, Oracle MySQL, or similar relational database platform
* Experience using NoSQL databases like Cosmos DB, Dynamo DB, Mongo DB, etc. highly desirable
* Highly experienced implementing web pages using HTML and CSS
* Backend REST API development is strongly desired
* Must be local Arizona resident
* Recent hands-on experience with Angular, React, or similar JavaScript framework is a plus
* Advanced level of understanding of object-oriented programming and object-oriented principles such as SOLID is a plus
* Hands on experience with design patterns (GOF, PEAA)
* Highly experienced with development of a service-oriented architecture (SOA) using REST APIs
* Through knowledge of .NET, Web API and/or Java Spring, Jersey, Micronaut or other frameworks to build RESTful APIs
* .NET core experience is a plus
* Solid understanding of test-driven development including mock object frameworks such as Moq or Mockito
* Experience with one or more source control platforms such as Git, Team Foundation Server (TFS), Subversion, Perforce, or other SCC application
* Experienced in Agile methodologies such as Scrum

Preferred skills, but not required:
* Experience developing applications for Microsoft Azure or Amazon AWS, or Google or other cloud platforms for large-scale, multi-tenant, SaaS systems
* Experience with NoSQL databases like Azure Cosmos DB, Amazon DynamoDB, Mongo DB, Cassandra, or other similar platforms
* Experience with container technologies like Docker
* Recent experience with TypeScript

Kforce is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, protected veteran status, or disability status.

- provided by Dice

items.content:
C# DEVELOPER

Immediate need for a .NET Developer to help with new development and legacy conversion to C# .NET. Successful candidates must have 3+ years of professional development experience working with C# and ASP.NET. They should also have relational database experience (IBM DB2 or other RDBMS). Applicants must have experience in the design, development, and unit testing of .NET applications. The most important qualifications will be the willingness to learn, a strong commitment to quality, excellent communication skills and the ability to work on their own as well as with a team!

Responsibilities:

  • Work as part of an agile development team to write C# code for enterprise systems.
  • Ability to work independently without direct supervision.
  • Design in collaboration with a team to satisfy business requirements.
  • Collaborate with product owners on requirements gathering and refinement.
  • Participate in knowledge sharing activities with colleagues.
  • On occasion, the availability to work modified shifts.

Technical Experience / Education:

  • Minimum 3 years of C# developer experience.
  • Experience with intermediate to advanced SQL.
  • A Bachelor s Degree in Engineering, Computer Science or related field is preferred.
  • Equivalent combination of knowledge and specialized experience may be acceptable in lieu of a degree.
  • Experience with agile development methodologies.
  • Experience with unit testing.
  • Experience with web browser technologies such as ASP.NET, MVC, HTML 5, JavaScript, jQuery, CSS, AJAX.
  • Experience with web site setup and maintenance in IIS 7+.
  • Experience with source control systems (TFS or other system).

Company Benefits:

  • 401(k) Plan with company match
  • Medical/Dental/Vision Benefits
  • Life and Disability Insurance

Physical Demands and Work Environment:

The physical demands and work environment characteristics described here are representative of those an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of the job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

Employee will occasionally need to lift or move equipment weighing up to 15 pounds. Dexterity of hands and fingers to operate a computer keyboard. Hearing and speaking to exchange information. Seeing to view computer monitor. Sitting for extended periods of time.

Professional office environment: temperature controlled office building, low noise level, standard office lighting.

Work from Home Requirements:

If working from home, you ll need to provide:

  • A quiet and uninterrupted workspace (no background noises which could hinder customer or employee interactions)
  • Broadband internet connection. (Minimum 25 mbps download and 10 mbps upload)
  • Connection to the router/modem via a wired ethernet port.
- provided by Dice

The culture has a family feel and employees can move to other departments.? The Information Technology department is a collaborative work environment.? This position is open due to growth.?

The SAP and .NET Software Programmer is responsible for designing and writing SAP software within project timelines. ?This position will report to the Application Development Manager.? The successful candidate will learn .net if they are lacking that experience.? The department will be going through a conversion from SAP ECC 6.0 to SAP S/4HANA so the employees will gain that experience as well.? The culture is important here so establishing and maintaining effective working relationships with others is important.? This person will be responsible for?maintaining confidentiality.The company is located in north central Wisconsin but welcomes employees to work remotely.

  • 4 years of software applications development experience
  • 4 years of experience?developing ABAP

  • Knowledge of FI, CO, MM, PP, SD functional areas in SAP

S/4HANA experience is pr eferred but not required.

Senior Sitecore Developer at Cameron Craig Group

Remote | High-paying

Location: Sylvania, OH

Type: Direct Hire

Salary: $95,000 – $105,000/year

ID j-204

Sitecore Software Developer (on-site preference, potential for remote and salary flexibility for right candidate)

One career opportunity with a choice of regional locations to work out of for this on-site role at a great company – very much into a healthy workplace, terrific and unique benefits with a culture that allows for participation in all stages of the development from defining the project to design to implementation, debugging, and testing. You will deploy the application across multiple systems in a fast-paced project applying an agile development schedule.

If you are comfortable being in the thick of things working with developers, project leads and project stakeholders to understand and resolve issues and clarify requirements this is a great opportunity. Expect to respond to production issues conducting root cause analysis and identifying the underlying issue.

Compensation will vary depending upon the work location you choose. Generous benefits and time-off days, medical, vision, dental, 401k, flex spending account and more.

Must-Have:

  • 5+ years of experience developing on the Sitecore platform (working knowledge of Sitecore 9.0 preferred; Sitecore 8.2+ required)
  • 5+ years of experience designing and developing software using C# and ASP.NET MVC
  • 2+ years as a team lead with excellent communication skills and proven ability to mentor/coach fellow developers regarding best practices
  • Experience building, inspecting, and managing deployments using Azure DevOps
  • Experience using Glass, Synthesis, or another ORM Mapper/Wrapper for Sitecore, Experience using TDS and/or Unicorn for tracking Sitecore item changes

Nice-to-Have:

  • Experience with: Object-oriented programming and computer science foundations
  • Software security best practices
  • .Net Framework, Visual Studio, C#, ASP.NET, WCF, Web API/REST Services.
  • HTML5, CSS, JSON, XML, AJAX, JavaScript and JavaScript frameworks (JQuery, Angular, React, etc.)
  • Current Web UI frameworks such as Bootstrap and Foundation
  • Relational database design and development
  • Agile methodologies and tools, unit testing, content management systems
  • Experience w/ the following is a plus: Azure PaaS, Helix, Sitecore certification
  • BS Computer Science or equivalent experience preferred

hiringOrganization.name: Work From Home Job AJ Online

items.content:
Data Entry Work From Home

Are you looking for a way great to use your data entry skills to earn money? Or maybe you're a customer service rep looking for a way to supplement your current income? Read our entire listing to learn how you can start earning money online doing data entry.

In this role you'll be responsible for participating in market research for Fortune 500 companies who gather data to help shape their products and services. This a requires data entry minimum typing speed of 25 words per minute. Additionally this is an entry level position a growing technological field. AOJ connects you to companies who need your feedback and data entry input. In this role you'll use your current skill-sets as well as learn exciting new skills that can easily transition to any career you choose. Workers are needed to do data entry from home as more companies require people to write reviews, get paid to test their products and services. Their is a never any associated monetary investment on your part.

Benefits of working at home

  • Work when you want - part time or full time
  • Make serious cash
  • No commute
  • No dress code requirements
  • Give your car a rest, you won't need to drive when you work online from home
  • We provide training for all applicants
  • Spend more time living your life because you spend much ZERO time driving to and from work
  • Can be great supplemental income for stay at home moms, retired persons, disabled persons and those who want to earn money in between jobs
  • So much more...

Application takes about 20 minutes. Don't want to read more, just want to start? Click on our web site and go!


www.AOJWorkFromHomeJobs.com


Here's what you need to provide

  • Sincere determination and focus, ability to follow directions, desire to follow through
  • Because this is a work at home online job you need Internet and 1 of the following:
  • Smart Device / Smart Phone, Laptop or computer (MAC or Windows)
  • Able to speak English, Spanish is a bonus (but not mandatory) as this will allow you to connect with more opportunity
  • Be at least 18!

We're eager to find motivated people who want an entry level data entry opportunity working from home. If you have customer service skills, some administrative skills, know how to deal with others (human resources), enjoy doing data entry, able to check, send and compose email - these skills will be helpful, though not mandatory as this is entry level.

If you think this might be a good fit for you please let us know, reach out and visit our web site below to get started. Application process time varies from 5 minutes to 20 minutes. It's a snap!

www.AOJWorkFromHomeJobs.com

items.content:
Join us in our Sustainable Energy Revolution-Medior/ Senior full-stack developer

About this job

Job type: Full-time
Experience level: Mid-Level, Senior
Role: Full Stack Developer
Industry: 3D Models, Consulting, Solar
Company size: 11–50 people
Company type: Private
Company: The Sustainables BV | Amsterdam, Netherlands

Remote details

Office Location: Amsterdam, Netherlands. Employees can also work full time from this office.

Technologies

c#
asp.net
javascript
azure
vue.js
Robert Massa Software engineer at The Sustainables 2.7k 1 21 39

Job description

As our Senior Software Engineer you will build and own our complex core APIs and frontends, improve our Azure cloud infrastructure, design and develop new services and applications, research and apply new technologies and engineering practices.

The solutions we provide are generally complex and customized, the team is in close contact with our partners and has a major role in finding suitable solutions for the aim of our customers. You will be involved in the complete lifecycle of the products. "You build it, you run it".

You will be also spending time on general company things, from writing a new vacancy text to being involved the company innovation process.

About The Sustainables

We make it easy for homeowners to transform their homes into energy efficient buildings by providing high-tech and scalable tools to our business partners.

Recent project front-ends:

  • https://homeqgo.nl “White label” sustainability advice and shop
  • https://plusjehuis.essent.nl sustainability advice and shop
  • https://www.engie-bespaaradvies.nl Sustainability advice for ENGIE (utility)

The projects mentioned above are publicly available tools that make use of an extensive back-end which we are happy to introduce to you in a personal talk.

What we offer

  • A lot of of professional growth opportunities and we really mean it :)
  • High pace, short development cycles
  • Flexibility in the use of tooling and techniques
  • Simple and stable development process
  • Opportunity to work on different kind of projects to polish your skills
  • Flexible working hours, or partially working from home

And some other perks

  • Team lunch every day
  • Lot's of team events (including going abroad together)
  • Conferences
  • Friday kickboxing :)

Your profile

Essential skills

  • Strong software engineering and architecting skills, and a desire to keep learning
  • Experience with shipping high-quality products (including design, development, release and monitoring phases)
  • .NET stack - we use .NET 4.7 and .NET Core, ASP.NET MVC and ASP.NET Core as our web frameworks, EF and EF Core

Nice to have

  • Frontend development - any modern frameworks like angular, react, vue (we use vue.js)
  • Experience with relational databases - we use SQL Server (and sometimes MongoDB and Redis)
  • Azure knowledge(or a desire to gain it) since we use it extensively
  • Experience working in an Agile Scrum environment
Apply now

About The Sustainables BV

We offer innovative solutions that make sustainable purchases easier and more profitable.

How we do that? By building smart online tools to measure houses remotely. Thanks to these tools, consumers can easily request offers for home improvements and sustainable energy.

That is how we connect businesses and consumers. The result: a better customer experience and substantial cost savings.

Benefits

  • Awesome colleagues and great development culture
  • Bleeding edge technologies
  • Very spacious office
  • Boxing every Friday (for our Amsterdam colleagues)
  • Team lunch every day (for our Amsterdam colleagues)
  • Colleagues always in for (water)sports
  • Regular team events
